As a Data & Analytics Engineer you will be responsible for the conversion of business process requirements into IT requirements and functional specifications. More specifically, you will be a part of the Data & Analytics Agile teams either in Unity or business as usual projects and assist in the design, development, testing and release of the Reporting/Analytics user stories to Production. This position is well suited for someone who is looking to advance their career in reporting and advanced analytics.

This role is internally known as: Data & Analytics Business IT Consultant
What we give
With Canon, you'll get the support and encouragement you need to grow, from people who share your ambition. We'll invest in your professional development to help you learn and progress in your role with us. You'll find leaders who give you the freedom to explore new things and a team where knowledge is shared openly.

In addition to a competitive salary depending on experience, you'll be eligible for a performance-based bonus of 12,5%. We have recently implemented a new range of flexible benefits including a strong contributory pension plan, discounts on health insurances, bicycle plan, plus employee discounts on Canon products.
Canon also champions hybrid working and a flexible working policy, with 31 days holiday per year. Lastly, you'll find that Canon encourages continuous Learning and Development with a wide range of resources and support available on demand.
What we ask

As a Data & Analytics Engineer, you will:
Translate business reporting requirements into IT solution designs.
Ensure hands-on (touch the code) delivery focusing on Design/Dev/Testing & QA and supporting release in Production.
Coordinate external providers in creating the solution, supporting business in UAT and business implementation of the solution.
Support & execute trainings where relevant to the end users
Assist lead BIC in developing project plans including budgets, timelines and forecast
Work closely with BIOPS to ensure that all related Production issues (user stories) related to BIOPS are delivered and provide QA on the same.
Have functional knowledge of one the Business functions (for example Finance, Supply Chain, Contract Management).
You will need
Education in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or related technical field. Masters Degree is a plus.
Experience in an IT development function, of which 3 years relevant functional/technical design experience.
Good problem-solving and sound-decision making capabilities, recognized by alternative solutions, and confident, accurate, decision-making coupled with good communication and interpersonal skills.
Solid knowledge of the domain applications is required: OAS (Oracle Application Server), Power BI and Informatica, proven by certification \ track record.
Technical experience with Azure Databricks and/or Datalakes.
Strong experience in writing functional requirements following use cases and following Agile methodologies
The ability to organize and lead meetings, set out actions and perform progress control on deliverables.
Understanding of BI Architecture & Technologies
Further Information
Does this seem like a great fit for your career expectations? We're excited to hear from you! Please click the 'apply now' button down below to submit your resume. You will be part of an energetic and innovative environment with more than 50 different nationalities! Even if you don't meet all the qualifications we still encourage you to apply.
Please note that we only accept application in English and via our career portal (those in other languages or sent via email will not be considered).
This role is based in Amstelveen office, near Amsterdam. We will offer as much support as possible to ensure a smooth transition to the Netherlands if needed.

Job Family: IT Development
Grade: 12

#LI-Hybrid
Canon is enriching lives and businesses in incredible new ways. You can play a part in shaping the future of a company that’s visionary, innovative and bold. As the world's best imaging company, we're living and working together for the common good.

Source is seeking a talented person who is driven to push the boundaries of the status quo and explore the unknown. You'll partner with our Data Science team & wider product team to create ground-breaking technology related to how plants grow & develop. This is an incredible opportunity to bring positive change to the global food system through better understanding & control of plants' behaviour. At Source we are building an international, multi-disciplinary team consisting of the brightest talents that the fields of computer & data science, engineering, and plant science have to offer. As a data scientist at Source, you will be working on dynamic models that simulate and control plant growth and climate in high-tech greenhouses. Those models enable growers to grow more food predictably and energy-efficiently.

What we’d love you to get excited about:

Applying & mixing techniques from the fields of biology, physics, statistics, and machine learning, in order to capture the complexity of the problems
Building and deploying models and data transformation pipelines, and integrating them into existing products
Working hand-in-hand with growers to deeply understand the problems at stake & define ways to solve them
You have a natural curiosity and you love to find the right solution for a specific problem. You are focused and detail-oriented, with an ability to structure complex problems into pragmatic solutions. We expect you to be especially eager to learn the Plant Science aspect of our business which is critical to the success of our models. Further, you have:

A clear motivation for our mission
MSc or Ph.D. degree in a quantitative discipline
3+ years of applied experience with machine learning libraries, using Python

Bonus points

If you have experience with optimization methods (e.g. linear programming, gradient descent, optimal control)
If you have experience with signal processing, dynamic systems modelling, or control systems engineering
If you have experience with developing models end-to-end, from ideation to deployment in the cloud (AWS)

At Source, we highly value diversity of backgrounds and thoughts. Research has shown that people make different internal assessments of whether they are a good fit for the job. We therefore highly encourage you to apply to this job, even if you feel you might not 'tick all the boxes'!

job_titles: Postdoc Position on Digitally Enforceable Data Sharing Contracts
job_description:
This is Adyen

Adyen provides payments, data, and financial products in a single solution for customers like Facebook, Uber, H&M, and Microsoft - making us the financial technology platform of choice. At Adyen, everything we do is engineered for ambition.

For our teams, we create an environment with opportunities for our people to succeed, backed by the culture and support to ensure they are enabled to truly own their careers. The people of Adyen are motivated individuals who tackle unique technical challenges at scale and solve them as a team. Together, we deliver innovative and ethical solutions that help businesses achieve their ambitions faster.

Data Scientist

Adyen is looking for a Data Scientist to join our team in Amsterdam, to jump into any problem and analyse, forecast, detect patterns and draw insights by leveraging data science algorithms and the big data platform, and thus enable teams to go beyond. We are currently expanding in two key areas:

Our graph based technologies and use cases that focus on value generation through graphs for our merchants (catching fraudsters and providing insights).
Our predictive monitoring capabilities to detect patterns and anomalies in our time series data.

You will be responsible for building and interpreting algorithms that power data products at Adyen. In this role, you will:

Obtain insights by leveraging machine learning algorithms. In this role specifically you will either be:
Applying time series analysis and anomaly detection techniques to uncover disruptions in our merchant's payment flows, or;
Building graphs and using graph based machine learning methods to generate insights and identify fraudulent patterns.
Develop orchestrated pipelines for analytical purposes and machine learning training.
Iterate with merchants and product audiences creating algorithms that power state of the art machine learning based solutions, and be able to explain the reasons behind the executed inference.
Setup and run experiments to validate hypotheses.
Stay up-to-date with the latest research and developments in the machine learning field, and apply this where applicable.

Who you are

You have 3+ years of experience as Data Scientist.
You have experience developing, training, validating, benchmarking and monitoring machine learning algorithms.
You have experience leveraging a big data framework to create the pipelines needed to feed the models with appropriate data.
You approach problems with a statistical mindset, keeping inference as a product of data science. Experience with statistical testing (confidence, p-value, A/B testing, Bayesian) is a plus.
You can communicate complex outcomes with clarity over a wide range of audiences.
Technologies: Extensive knowledge of data science and statistics techniques, toolsets and algorithms, such as e.g. Spark, Scikit-Learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch, XGBoost, Pandas, Airflow, SQL.
Mentality: An experimental mindset with a launch fast and iterate mentality. A strong statistics/mathematics background is a plus.

Data Positions at Adyen

We know companies handle different definitions for their data-related positions, this is for instance dependent on the size of a company. Since the birth of the Data Solution and the growth of all data streams, we categorized and defined all our positions. Have a look at this blogpost to find out!

Our Diversity, Equity and Inclusion commitments

Our unique approach is a product of our diverse perspectives. This diversity of backgrounds and cultures is essential in helping us maintain our momentum. Our business and technical challenges are unique, and we need as many different voices as possible to join us in solving them - voices like yours. No matter who you are or where you're from, we welcome you to be your true self at Adyen.

Studies show that women and members of underrepresented communities apply for jobs only if they meet 100% of the qualifications. Does this sound like you? If so, Adyen encourages you to reconsider and apply. We look forward to your application!

What's next?

Ensuring a smooth and enjoyable candidate experience is critical for us. We aim to get back to you regarding your application within 5 business days. Our interview process tends to take about 4 weeks to complete, but may fluctuate depending on the role. Learn more about our hiring process here. Don't be afraid to let us know if you need more flexibility.

Please note that this role is a full-time position in Amsterdam. It will require a relocation in case you live outside of the Netherlands.

job_titles: PhD position in AI Tools for Analyzing Multimodal Data in Law Enforcement

job_description:
Complexe uitdagingen, slimme oplossingen en een enorme drive om de organisatie te helpen in de ambitie om maximale waarde uit data te halen?
Spreekt dit je aan en heb jij ruime ervaring als Data Engineer? Zet dan de volgende stap en kom ons vakkundige team versterken!
Wij zijn op zoek naar een getalenteerde Data Engineer die ons kan helpen bij het opbouwen en uitbreiden van ons data platform. Ben jij iemand met een passie voor het bijdragen aan de ontwikkeling van een state-of-art dataplatform binnen een internationale werkomgeving? Dan is deze baan iets voor jou!
Wat doet een Data engineer bij Dustin
Binnen Dustin bouwen we aan een state-of-art dataplatform gebaseerd op Microsoft Azure technologie en gebruiken we tools en talen als Data Factory, Databrics, Python, SQL etc. De impact die je als Data Engineer hebt op de ambities van Dustin kan groots zijn. Denk daarbij aan het creëren van slimme, geavanceerde en betrouwbare data-oplossingen zoals het optimaliseren en automatiseren van data pipelines door het toepassen van de gaafste technologie. Je wordt continue uitgedaagd om je skills te verbeteren en je kennis te verbreden. Je gaat een bijdrage leveren om ervoor te zorgen dat onze klanten de beste beleving ervaren als ze een product of dienst afnemen bij Dustin. We bieden je de kans om jezelf (verder) te ontwikkelen binnen een groeiende organisatie. Ben jij in staat om het eigenaarschap te pakken? Dan krijg je de ruimte om jouw ideeën verder te ontwikkelen.
Is data jouw passie en wil e samenwerken met een team dat luistert naar jouw input en ideeën, is dit de baan voor jou.
Team
Je maakt deel uit van een internationaal team van data-engineers binnen de Dustin Group. Je levert een bijdrage aan de ontwikkeling van nieuwe componenten op het data platform. Je gaat werken in een team dat volledig scrum/agile werkt. We zijn een hecht team dat een enorme drive heeft om continue te verbeteren en de beste oplossingen te bedenken voor onze organisatie.
Onze data platform maakt gebruik van Azure Data Lake, Azure Data Factory en Databricks. Python en SQL.
Je krijgt continu mogelijkheden om jezelf verder te ontwikkelen en hebt een deskundig team om je heen. Ze streven allemaal naar een vriendelijke en ondersteunende cultuur en genieten van het delen van hun kennis, het bereiken van gemeenschappelijke doelen en het verbinden van elkaar.
Dit krijg je ervoor terug
We geloven dat we zoveel meer te bieden hebben dan wat we in onderstaande lijst kunnen benoemen. Maar dat weet je natuurlijk pas als je bij ons werkt.
Wat je sowieso moet weten:

27 vakantiedagen bij een fulltime dienstverband
Salaris, dat wordt ingeschaald aan de hand van je opleiding en ervaring
Je pensioenbijdrage word volledig door Dustin vergoed en je kunt meedoen aan een collectieve zorgverzekering
Reiskostenvergoeding van  0,24 per km of volledige OV vergoeding
Tegen inkoopprijs kan je IT-hardware (voor eigen gebruik) aanschaffen via onze webshop
Bij Dustin geldt: digital first! Dit houdt in dat jij, uiteraard in overleg met je team en leidinggevende, bepaalt wat voor jou en je team de beste verhouding van werken vanuit kantoor en werken vanuit huis is.
Wij brengen een stukje Dustin bij jou thuis en zorgen voor een volledige thuiswerkplek!

Bij Dustin geven we prioriteit aan persoonlijke ontwikkeling en groei door middel van geïndividualiseerde plannen en toegang tot onze Dustin Academy. Daarnaast bevorderen we een gezonde levensstijl via onze Dustin Movement-activiteiten.
Wie ben jij
Jij bent een enthousiast persoon die geïnteresseerd is in het werken met nieuwe technologieën en oplossingen. Je bent sterk in communicatie en iemand die graag problemen oplost.
En ook belangrijk is

Je hebt een technische Bachelor of Master afgerond, bij voorkeur in Computer Science of Computer Engineering
Meerdere jaren werkervaring in een soortgelijke rol
Hands-on ervaring met de Microsoft Azure stack. Kennis met Google BigQuery, Snowflake etc. is ook welkom
Je hebt beheerst Python en SQL
Het is een plus als je kennis hebt van data modeling en de best practices voor ETL
Je weet hoe je moet werken met een Version Control System
Omdat je gaat samenwerken met ons internationale Data & Insights team ben je in staat je goed uit te drukken in de Engelse taal

Wij geloven dat onze collega's de belangrijkste reden zijn voor onze positieve ontwikkeling. En wij geloven dat onze ontwikkeling je de mogelijkheid geeft om te groeien. Daarom kunnen we jou één ding beloven:
You keep us moving. We keep you moving.
Ons recruitment proces
We waarderen en omarmen verschillen in achtergrond en perspectief, dus zelfs als je geen 100% match bent voor deze rol, moedigen we je aan om te solliciteren!
De navolgende stappen mag je verwachten in ons wervingsproces:

Competentie assessment en cognitieve test
Telefonische screening
1e gesprek
2e gesprek
Referenties
Arbeidsvoorwaardenvoorstel (startdatum wordt in overleg bepaald)

Het is ons doel als bedrijf om te zorgen voor een inclusieve cultuur. We anonimiseren alle sollicitaties en screenen alleen op basis van ervaring, vaardigheden, competentiebeoordeling en een cognitieve test. Dit doen we om te zorgen voor een proces zonder (onbewuste) vooroordelen van recruiters en managers.
We screenen en evalueren kandidaten voortdurend en sluiten de vacature af wanneer we de juiste persoon voor de functie hebben gevonden. Daarom hebben we geen deadline voor de sollicitatie.
Als je vragen hebt over de functie, neem dan contact op met talent acquisition partner Manon van Lieshout +31 - 6 1008 7593 of manon.vanlieshout@Dustin.com.
Meer informatie over onze stappen naar sociale gelijkheid lees je hier: https://www.dustingroup.com/en/our-focus-areas.
&feature=youtu.be

You will be part of a team that is working on the migration to our new data warehouse (Snowflake). Multiple teams are working on this migration; your team focuses on our SAP source systems. Including you, the team is 10 strong and falls under the BI reporting value chain. In this value chain, several teams are busy developing insights for key Enexis themes. We migrate the data foundation for the reports resulting from their work.
Job Description
• You will be working on migrating the current Enexis DataWarehouse to the Enexis DataPlatform
• You design, develop and test ETL processes to be migrated; the data will be used for data analysis and reports for internal Enexis clients
• You advise and ensure that the relevant data complies with security and privacy laws and regulations (Development)
• You are responsible for the quality of the delivered software and products. Testing and communicating the results is part of your delivery (Development)
 • You are responsible for ensuring that the software and products meet the Enexis architecture guidelines (Development)
• You are responsible for managing the migrated ETL jobs until they are transferred to the relevant chain team (Operations)
• You take action to follow up on operational monitoring/incidents (Operations)
• Collaboration within the team is based on agile principles (SAFe methodology). You have previously worked with Scrum or Kanban

The current infrastructure is transitioning to a Cloud environment with new tools. This means that you will have to deal with various data warehouses, a large amount of data and a dynamic ICT work environment that brings many changes, challenges and opportunities. You are a good fit in this context and derive energy from this dynamic.
Job Requirements
You have a good eye for results and are a team player. With your knowledge, keen eye and analytical skills, you have no trouble sifting through existing flows and finding ways to convert them to the new system. In addition, you feel at home in a role where you often operate independently and get a variety of questions shot at you.
You have a higher vocational education (HBO) or university (WO) degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or a similar field
You have at least 3 years of experience as a data engineer
Experience with Snowflake and if possible Oracle
Experience in designing ETL processes. (Experience with Matillion, SAP BODS and/or SAP Data Services is a plus)
Experience with SAP BusinessObjects
Experience with Cloud AWS (S3), versioning (GitLab)
Experience with SAS is nice to have
You bring extensive data warehouse knowledge (>3 years of experience) from a Development perspective. Knowledge of dimensional modelling is a plus
You are analytically strong
Knowledge of the following is a plus: Agile SAFe
You speak fluently dutch
Salary and Benefits
And, of course, we will also put our energy into you
At Enexis, you will be working at the forefront of one of the greatest challenges of our time: the energy transition. Needless to say, we look after you as well. First of all, we offer a comprehensive welcome package and onboarding programme to get to know your colleagues. And also great employment benefits:
A gross monthly salary between 3,611 and 5,158 (based on 40 hours/week). Including fringe benefits, your salary can be up to  6,226 gross per month
We contribute 70% of your ABP Flexible Pension premium.
A personal budget of 10% and a 13th month at 10.7% of your gross annual salary. You can use these flexibly or have them paid out monthly or annually.
24.5 days of leave for full-time employment. If you need more time to recharge your batteries, you can buy up to 35.5 additional days of leave with your personal budget and 13th month.
Opportunities to work from home, including a home office set up by us and an allowance of 25 per month.
Laptop or tablet and phone that you can also use privately.
Travel cost reimbursement and a first-class public transport pass for business use.
A vitality budget of 500 for a fitness centre membership, for example.
Room to grow with our internal development platform or external education and training.
Work on tomorrow's energy network as a Data Engineer

Good to know
When you apply, we will send you an email explaining the details of the procedure. The procedure usually consists of two interviews: an initial (online) interview with the manager and recruiter and a second interview with your future colleagues on site.

A screening is part of the application process. This may include an assessment and request for references and a Certificate of Good Conduct (Dutch VOG). We will send you more information about this during the application process.

Interested? You can apply in both Dutch or English. If you have any questions, feel free to contact Jasper Ohler

job_titles: Senior Data Scientist (12 month Maternity Cover)
job_description:
Oss, Noord-Brabant
Squadra Machine Learning Company is een vernieuwend Nederlands bedrijf wat kennis over bedrijfsprocessen, data mining, statistiek en data visualisatie combineert met als doel klanten te helpen met machine learning algoritmes en het toepassen van kunstmatige intelligentie. We hebben een passie voor Data Science en Machine Learning in het bijzonder. Machine Learning is een krachtige techniek waardoor software intelligente taken kan uitvoeren die tot voor kort voornamelijk door mensen uitgevoerd werden. Daarmee helpen we onze klanten diverse bedrijfs- en industriële processen, klantgerichte diensten en andere data gedreven functies op een vernieuwende wijze te automatiseren.

Wie ben jij?
Je bent bezig aan een master of HBO opleiding in de exacte wetenschappen (Artificial Intelligence, Data Science, Econometrie, Wiskunde, etc)
Je hebt ervaring met Phyton/ R
Je werkt graag met real life datasets in plaats van de standaard beschikbare datasets
Je vindt het leuk om te onderzoeken of je onze diensten kunt verbeteren met jouw model/techniek.
Wat bieden wij jou?
Een financiële vergoeding
Begeleiding van onze specialisten
Dagelijks verzorgde lunch
Maandelijkse teambuilding en gezamelijke activiteiten

To deliver on this ambition of a Powered by Data strategy we need talent with expertise and experience of data science and advanced analytics to deliver multiple initiatives and help lead the change in data and pet- and pet-centric thinking across the entire Mars Petcare business.
The purpose of this role is to join and be an integral part of the Ecosystem/Cross-Division function, planning, and leading projects to deliver the Powered By Data project across Mars Petcare divisions using the ecosystem of data available.
We need an individual who can apply their knowledge and experience of data science / ML techniques to our unique data sets and lead data science projects.
The role involves hands-on delivery of analytics and insight as well as leading and mentoring others.
What are we looking for?
An independent, self-starter to both manage and lead a Platform Data Science/ML Ops team of 4 people
Demonstrable experience of using data science and advanced analytics to generate business value and change
Experience and knowledge using Python (NumPy, pandas, etc.) is required; Familiarity with PySpark is also desirable
Must have excellent communication skills, and interact effectively with all levels of internal / external business stakeholders to engage and Influence
Strong problem-solving skills
Master's degree or equivalent experience in the fields of Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or other numerate discipline
What will be your key responsibilities?
Creating data mining architectures/models/protocols, statistical reporting, and data analysis methodologies to identify trends in large data sets
Analysis may be applied to various areas of the business (e.g., Market Economics, Supply Chain, Marketing/Advertising, Scientific Research, etc.)
Researching and applying knowledge of existing and emerging data science principles, theories, and techniques to inform business decisions
What can you expect from Mars?
Work with over 130,000 diverse and talented Associates, all guided by The Five Principles.
Join a purpose driven company, where we’re striving to build the world we want tomorrow, today.
Best-in-class learning and development support from day one, including access to our in-house Mars University.
An industry competitive salary and benefits package, including company bonus.

At LeasePlan, we are always asking What's next in mobility.
Join our team and be part of a dynamic, exciting and engaging business, so we can discover What’s next together!
Who are we?
At LeasePlan, AI is a core component of expanding our digital presence to create the ‘Future of Digital’ in mobility. As part of the Enterprise Data & Analytics (EDA) department, the AI Engineering team functions as a global Center of Excellence for AI and Data Science throughout the organisation.

We leverage the AWS technology stack with data from 32 organisational entities - made available on our data platform Global Data Hub (GDH) - to generate business value. For this purpose, we identify opportunities across different LeasePlan value streams and engage with stakeholders, data engineers and solution developers to solve complex business problems using machine learning and advanced statistics. The primary focus is to apply data mining techniques and build high quality prediction systems integrated with business and digital products.
Who are we looking for?
We are looking for an enthusiastic Senior Data Scientist / AI Engineer who is not only excited about solving complex analytical problems, but also about applying and deploying their solutions in a dependable, consistent and lasting way that adds value to our business. You should have a solid background in integration, testing and deployment of ML models. Data science is proliferating at LeasePlan; we are growing the team in all directions, and are looking for someone who enjoys contributing to that growth and working in this changing, fast-paced environment.
What are you going to do?Collaborate with business, digital products and engineering department to understand company needs and devise possible data science solutions.Build scalable data science solutions in a cloud environment (AWS) using python and PySpark.Develop projects through proof-of-concept, pilot and full deployment phases.Further develop our cloud based AI Platform to improve our technical infrastructure, standards of working and tool stack.Connect the final model with other aspects of the application; design and control how they communicate with one another (REST APIs, database queries, etc..).Communicate results and ideas to key decision makers; explain complex use cases at an appropriate level for the audience using effective data visualization techniques.Liaise with other Data Science teams at other LeasePlan entities to streamline implementations and share knowledge.Experiment with new ideas, technologies and data to identify new data science use cases.
What do you need to do the job?MSc in mathematics, statistics, computer science or related field; PhD degree (preferred) OR equivalent experience.>5 to 7 years experience as a Data Scientist (at least two years of them as a Senior)Ability to solve complex analytical problems using quantitative approaches with a unique blend of analytical, mathematical and technical skills.Excellent understanding of machine learning techniques and algorithms, such as k-NN, Naive Bayes, SVM, Decision Forests, etc.Strong data-oriented scripting (e.g. SQL), statistical programming (e.g., python or R) and big data frameworks (e.g. Spark, Hadoop MapReduce).Experience with cloud technologies, preferably AWS stack.Strong understanding of software engineering best practices such as requirements analysis, system design, modularity, version control, testing, documentation, etc..Strong knowledge of and experience with ML testing and deployment strategy (e.g. CI/CD, // architecture).Proven track record over multiple aspects of the end-to-end machine learning life cycle from proof of concepts to scalable solutions in production.Experience with data visualization tools, such as D3.js, R Shiny, Python dash etc.Good stakeholder management and communication skills.
How is life at LeasePlan Digital?
With around 1.7 Million cars in over 30 countries and more than 50 years of experience on a global scale, LeasePlan is the largest automobile leasing and fleet management company in the world. LeasePlan Digital, is there to create our ambition for a customer centric experience across all digital touch points, to deliver true value to our customers and in turn maximize long-term customer satisfaction.
We offer a start-up atmosphere, incorporated in one of the world's leading fleet management companies. That means a working environment surrounded by like-minded innovators working together from their home offices using Microsoft Teams, Jira, Confluence and other tools to get the job done together. Our working community is close, sharing work and personal related matters to stay connected.
You can expect a competitive salary and benefits, room to grow and plenty of can-do attitudes. Most importantly? You'll get the opportunity to help shape the future of an exciting, dynamic industry.
This role is based in Amsterdam. To apply, just upload your information via the link and apply directly. We are looking forward to exploring your opportunities with us!
Why LeasePlan?
LeasePlan is a global leader in Car-as-a-Service, with approximately 1.9 million vehicles under management in 29 countries. LeasePlan purchases, funds and manages new vehicles for its customers, providing a complete end-to-end service for a typical contract duration of three to four years. Through our NextGen Digital strategy, we are transforming from an analogue into a fully digitally-enabled business, delivering digital services at digital cost.
With over 55 years’ experience, LeasePlan's mission is to provide what’s next in sustainable mobility so our customers can focus on what's next for them. We aim to build an ethical, inclusive, and progressive culture in which people can thrive and be themselves regardless of their race, nationality, gender, age, disability, sexual orientation etc.
If you’d like to learn more about our culture, DE&I journey and our way of working, please find out more in our sustainability section and our latest Annual Report.
Follow @NextGenLeasePlan on Instagram and LeasePlan on LinkedIn to check out what LeasePlanners are up to everyday!

About Us: FarmTrace is an agri-tech startup that builds industry-leading software that connects to farm systems and manages agricultural systems. It is a fast-growing B2B platform company with data science operations in the agriculture and food industry. Led by a Dutch founder, with offices in the US, Amsterdam, and Boxmeer, FarmTrace brings farm and food information to its customers’ fingertips, providing transparency in key parts of the food value chain. Its groundbreaking digital architecture helps bridge cooperation between farmers, veterinarians, farm suppliers, and food processors.
Contribution to the organization
As Data Engineer, your focus is on the gathering, processing, and storing of data which is critical to the success of all FarmTrace customers. With your automation-first mindset, you focus on automating manual steps and streamlining the overall process of data gathering and processing. You use the latest techniques and have a drive for continuous learning and improvement in tools, techniques, and processes.
YOU WILL…
Drive for data quality, scalable data-flow, and machine learning applications, and help direct colleagues implementing such applications with industry coding best practices.
Design, implement, and maintain scalable data pipelines
Develop routines to improve data reliability, efficiency, and quality
Collaborate with domain experts, analysts, and backend engineers to solve data challenges
Apply data modeling techniques and contribute to a robust data platform
Master both technical skills and business sense to become an analytical multiplier within the company
Be pragmatic while delivering high-quality implementations

The Ideal Candidate
YOU HAVE…
A bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent
Strong knowledge of data structures, algorithms, and problem-solving skills
Experience with SQL and relational databases
Experience with Python or other programming languages
An understanding of data warehousing concepts and design patterns
You’re a great communicator who can explain and present technical topics to a varied audience
Fluent in written and spoken English

What We Offer
A valued position in a fast growing international startup.
Flexible working hours and own choice for remote or office work
Opportunities for growth within the company
An ambitious and friendly team open to support and help where necessary

Talenteeds is an international recruitment firm using digital tools to streamline the recruitment of executives and experts on permanent contracts.
Talenteeds has grown at the pace of its ambitions. We work with clients in Europe and North America who trust us to find them the candidates who will allow them to make a difference and to surround themselves with high-performance employees.
Want to know more? Apply! Write your career stories with us and tell us your successful paths
https://www.talenteeds.com/
About our client
Our client is close to its customers and collaborators.
It has always innovated to meet the growing challenges of a rapidly changing, powerful and diversified sector, with a range of professions, skills, know-how for which our client supports its employees to develop them and reveal new talents.
Job description
Job summary:
responsible for driving sustainability and digital transformation projects within the organization, as well as managing associated data. The role involves identifying opportunities for improvement, implementing solutions, and tracking progress towards sustainability goals.

Develop sustainability strategies for the organization, including goals for reducing environmental impact and plans for the adoption of sustainable practices and technologies.Identify and analyze data related to sustainability and digitization initiatives, including environmental impact, energy use, and resource consumption.Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify opportunities for improvement, develop solutions, and implement projects.Manage data related to sustainability and digitization initiatives, including collection, analysis, and reporting.Track progress towards sustainability goals and report on key performance indicators.Stay up-to-date on emerging trends and best practices related to sustainability and digitization.Communicate sustainability and digitization initiatives to internal and external stakeholders, including employees, customers, and partners.Develop and maintain relationships with external partners, including vendors, industry organizations, and regulatory bodies.Lead the development and implementation of sustainability-related policies and procedures.

Master's degree preferred.Experience in sustainability, digital transformation, or a related field.Strong project management skills, including the ability to lead cross-functional teams and manage multiple projects simultaneously.Strong analytical skills, with the ability to analyze data and make data-driven decisions.Excellent communication skills, with the ability to communicate complex sustainability and digitization concepts to a variety of audiences.Knowledge of sustainability standards and regulations, including carbon reporting and environmental impact assessments.Knowledge of digital technologies, including data analytics, Internet of Things (IoT), and artificial intelligence (AI).Familiarity with sustainability frameworks, such as the Global Reporting Initiative (GRI) or the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs).Demonstrated leadership ability, with the ability to inspire and motivate teams towards sustainability goals.

De Omgevingsdienst Flevoland & Gooi en Vechtstreek (OFGV) is een professionele regionale uitvoeringsorganisatie die adequaat milieu- en leefomgevingstaken uitvoert. De dienst doet dit voor alle gemeenten in zowel Flevoland als Gooi en Vechtstreek en voor de provincies Flevoland en Noord-Holland.Voor het team Bedrijfsvoering zoeken wij een: Data analist (32-36 uur per week).Houd jij van data? Vind je het leuk om gegevens om te zetten naar bruikbare informatie om sturing te geven aan onze organisatie? Dan hebben wij de baan voor jou!De OFGV heeft de afgelopen jaren geïnvesteerd in dit steeds belangrijker wordende onderdeel van ons werk. Voor de komende jaren willen wij een volgende stap zetten en onze data analyses naar een hoger niveau tillen.Je werkzaamhedenOm te beginnen is het belangrijk dat je scherp krijgt wat de informatiebehoefte is. Dit doe je door binnen de organisatie op te halen waar het gebruik van data de werkzaamheden van toezichthouders en vergunningverleners kan versterken.Vervolgens kijk je welke data beschikbaar zijn en voer je analyses uit op deze gegevens. Je zorgt voor een heldere rapportage of visualisatie van de resultaten en voor een nauwkeurige vastlegging van de analyses. Je presenteert je resultaten aan de collega’s en past zo nodig je analyses aan.Je coördineert de werkzaamheden van de andere medewerkers die zich bezig houden met dataverzameling, dataverrijking, datapreparatie, rapportages, analyses en visualisaties.Je onderhoudt een netwerk op het gebied van data-analyse en datagestuurd werken bij andere Omgevingsdiensten en de ketenpartners van de OFGV.Jouw profielWij zoeken iemand die:Een relevante afgeronde HBO-opleiding, de post HBO Big Data Analytics of WO-opleiding data science heeft.Kennis van en ervaring heeft met BI-tools, SQL en databases. Daarnaast heb je kennis van Excel en Access. Ook heb je affiniteit met analysetools zoals SPSS.Analytisch sterk, resultaatgericht is en goed kan adviseren. Een echte data-denker is en ook ben je communicatief vaardig waardoor je goed in staat bent om informatie over te brengen op de organisatie.Met enthousiasme en overtuigingskracht in staat is om iedereen straks te laten springen om jouw data analyses.Ons aanbodEen dienstverband voor de duur van 1 jaar met uitzicht op een vast dienstverbandSalaris (schaal 10)  3.396,- tot  5.009,- op basis van 36 uur per week afhankelijk van kennis en ervaringCirca 17% Individueel Keuze Budget (IKB)Een moderne en lerende werkomgeving en betrokken collega’sFlexibele werktijdenMiddelen om plaatsonafhankelijk digitaal te werkenEen ruime dienstreiskostenvergoedingEen eigen boom in het OFGV-bosCAO Samenwerkende Gemeentelijke OrganisatiesABP pensioenSolliciterenHeb je interesse? At Axelera AI we are building a novel software stack to unlock the power of industry-leading in-memory computing technology. Our software stack enables AI developers to transform their Machine Learning models into highly-optimized machine code for the Axelera hardware platform easily and efficiently and to run DL applications with high efficiency and performance.
Location
We offer a flexible working arrangement, with the option to relocate near an Axelera AI office (currently in the Netherlands, in Belgium and in Switzerland) or work remotely from any European country.
Your role
You will be a primary technical contributor to the architecture, design and implementation of Axelera’s Neural Network compiler and SDK.Your tasks will mainly include the following:
Have a leading role in the development of the Axelera NN compiler, including hands-on code contributions in diverse software engineering environments
Work with data scientists and AI experts to develop algorithms for transforming and optimizing Neural Networks for In-Memory Computing
Develop hardware-aware optimizations for the Axelera software stack
Create tools for ensuring high quality in the software development process
Build prototypes to evaluate algorithms and techniques at an exploratory stage before they are implemented in the product
Your profile
Master’s or PhD in Computer Science or a related technical field
3-5 years of experience in a Software Engineering role, thereof ideally 2 years of experience with Deep Learning frameworks and AI systems
Background in systems programming, incl. compiler development
Experience with open source compiler frameworks like TVM/MLIR/Glow is a plus
Excellent verbal and communication skills
Proficiency in C++ & Python
You are self-reliant, independent with high sense of ownership of your work and value freedom with responsibility
Who we are
Axelera AI is a truly European deep-tech Start Up company which is developing a game-changing hardware and software platform for AI at the edge that will make the industry more integrated, efficient and accessible. Our mission is to spread artificial intelligence for a green, fair, trusted and safe world enabling new application of AI in diverse sectors like smart cities, retail and other markets. Our company is a spin-off from a multinational deep-tech group and is backed by a strong syndicate of institutional investors. We have an extraordinary and international team of top talented researchers and developers working in the headquarter in Eindhoven (NL) and in the branch offices in Leuven (BE), Zurich (CH) and Pisa (IT).
What we offer
Take the chance to become part of a dynamic, fast-growing, international organization. We offer an attractive compensation package, including a pension plan, extensive employee insurances and the option to get company shares.
An open culture that not only supports creativity and continual innovation is awaiting you. Collaborative ownership and freedom with responsibility is characteristic for the way we act and work as a team.
Interested?
Great! We are looking forward to receiving your application! Feel free to contact us whenever you have any questions or for further information @Heike Wilfling, HR Business Partner +31621929159. For further information on Axelera AI please also have a look on our
website: www.axelera.ai
Do you want to stay informed about our journey and our current vacancies?Follow us on Linkedin

job_titles: Data Scientist - Payments, Risk and Fraud
job_description:
Corsano Health is looking for an enthusiastic and dynamic Data Scientist for our Yes!Delft office in The Hague. Reporting to the Chief Medical Officer, the Data Scientist works with users to define existing or new processes as well as to recommend solutions and improvements. The candidate needs to have strong project management skills and the ability to work independently, creatively and analytically in a problem-solving environment.

The position can start as a part-time commitment. Initially expected working hours are 8 hours per week. Pay will be commensurate with attitude, experience and hustle.

Your Impact

Work with users to define existing or new processes and recommend solutions and improvements. Serve as a liaison between users needs and the Strategic Improvement Department.
Develop test plans and verify plans to accurately validate business requirements.
Develop project work plans.
Document workflow processes.
Conduct analysis of alternatives, recommendations, and data mapping.
Selecting features, building and optimizing classifiers using machine learning techniques
Data mining using state-of-the-art methods
Extending company’s data with third party sources of information when needed
Enhancing data collection procedures to include information that is relevant for building analytic systems
Processing, cleansing, and verifying the integrity of data used for analysis
Doing ad-hoc analysis and presenting results in a clear manner
Creating automated anomaly detection systems and constant tracking of its performance

Minimum Qualifications

BSc Computer Science or Technical Medicine TU Delft, currently studying MSc.
Excellent understanding of machine learning techniques and algorithms, such as k-NN, Naive Bayes, SVM, Decision Forests, etc.
Experience with common data science toolkits, such as R, Weka, NumPy, MatLab, etc.
Great communication skills
Experience with data visualisation tools, such as D3.js, GGplot, etc.
Proficiency in using query languages such as SQL, Hive, Pig
Experience with NoSQL databases, such as MongoDB
Good applied statistics skills, such as distributions, statistical testing, regression, etc.
Good scripting and programming skills
Data-oriented personality
Highly effective communicator both orally and in writing; ability to explain matters precisely and efficiently, written and verbally
Organized and with attention to details.
Ability to interact independently and self-starting with colleagues and stakeholders.
Excellent presentation, teaching and communication skills (English).
Dedicated to professional growth through continuous education.

Your Team

Corsano Health B.V. is a Dutch company to develop, produce and market medically certified continuous health monitoring devices. Its first product, the Corsano CardioWatch 287 is an essential part of a cardiac arrhythmia screening system that can, by providing a simple and effective method for continuous monitoring of the wearers heart rhythm, help identify the risk of a heart attack in an early phase. In its most extended version, the system consists of a bracelet plus a dedicated app on the wearer’s smartphone. The system can assist the user with maintaining a healthy lifestyle by providing immediate feedback on activity, sleep and heart rhythm data, plus it provides relevant data for timely identification of heart rhythm anomalies.

Corsano Health B.V. and its CardioWatch 287 Bracelet are in the process to be medically certified respectively ISO 13485 and CE-MDR.


Apply by sending your resume to hr@corsano.com listing relevant employment history and motivation.

Why Recharge.com

We are the leading one-stop-shop for branded payments, making online recharge possible for anyone, anywhere at any time — whether you or someone you love needs credit for calling, gaming, entertainment or money. This is your chance to join an ambitious scaleup in a state of rapid growth; we’ll push you to develop yourself and help you create a real impact in your role. Put simply: we could write history together.
We won’t bore you with a corporate spiel about how we might be taking on the world of branded payments (spoiler: we are). Instead, we’ll let the numbers speak for themselves: +$70 million in funding (and counting!), +13000 products, +$500M sales, 3M customers, a presence in +160 countries, 6 consumer brands, a team of 150+ employees and 42+ nationalities, and 1 person missing — you.
We’re on the hunt for the hungriest and most passionate talent out there. If at any point your brain screams “I want in!” while you’re reading this, then consider this the sign you’ve been looking for: we want you too.
The role

Within Payment & Risk our aim is to minimise our fraud risk whilst maximising our payment performance (conversion) at the lowest possible cost across our global offering of payment methods. Historically we have depended predominantly on external service providers for fraud risk assessments, but over the past year we have started to develop our own internal “Risk Engine”.
We’re looking for a talented Data Scientist - Payment, Risk and Fraud to join us reporting to our Director Business Intelligence Bram Davids.
We need your help to continuously improve our payment & fraud risk abilities, by feeding our risk engine with pragmatic, smart and automated data solutions and continuously experiment, iterate, improve and extend the abilities of our risk engine.
Within this you will work closely together with stakeholders across our organisation, including the Payment & Risk Commercial and Tech teams, as well as our Business Analyst Payment & Risk.
What will I do?

Support Recharge.com and its business in preventing, detecting and investigating fraud patterns
Analyse and fully understand our payment and risk flow, understand where the biggest gains can be made and translate these in business cases and advice on how to shape our payment and risk infrastructure.
Work closely with the risk lead and operations team to continuously improve and automate their way of working.
Work closely together with our Business Analyst Payment & Risk, Data Platform and Payment & Risk Product team to ensure the right data capture, data quality and data flows are in place.
Develop, monitor and continuously improve intelligent and automated solution to reduce our fraud risk or improve our payment performance, for example
Automated rule setting (whitelist, blacklist, ….) for risk flow decision making
Fraud Probability Models for automated risk flow decision making
Fraud Clustering Models to be shared with external risk insurance services

Create business cases and evaluate and advise on external tooling to enrich our risk intelligence and automated, and work closely with our payment and risk product team on implementing it.
Work closely with cross-functional teams of data engineers, product manager , backend engineers, analysts, payment and risk specialists and other business teams
What you have

Bachelor’s Degree in Data Science, Business Intelligence, Statistics, Mathematics or similar quantitative discipline
At least 1 years’ work experience in data analytics or data science preferably in the digital goods, financial or payments industry
Previous experience working in fraud detection and prevention, with an understanding of the impact that has on other areas in the company where business and product decisions are made
Strong analytical and statistical analysis skills in order to extract insights and recommendations
Data analytics experience using SQL, Tableau and other big data tools; preferably in a financial services environment
Experience with Python based data operations
Basics of machine learning algorithms, API requests in nice to have
Self-starter with high level of intellectual curiosity and growth mindset
Fluent in English with strong communication skills (both written and verbal)

Great accountability & ownership that enables you to go the extra mile to solve any risk and fraud related matter
Pragmatic mindset, so starting with quick to implement, proof of concept, solutions and iterating from there
Don’t meet every single requirement? At Recharge we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace, so if you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.
What we offer

30 days of holiday, a great pension scheme, and one of the best relocation packages in Amsterdam
Flexible working hours and an office overlooking the Amstel
Macbook Pro (13”or 15”)
Budget for noise-cancelling headphones, travel to and from the office, working-from-home and self-learning
Free healthy breakfast, lunch and snacks by our in-house chef
Free Dutch classes to help out with daily life in the Netherlands
Regular parties, pub quizzes, bingo sessions, celebrations and other events

The process ️

1. Apply: Want in? Let us know! Apply for a role and help us get to know your best self.

2. Phone interview: One of our recruiters will get in touch to help you both understand if Recharge is the right next move for you.

3. First interview: You’ll meet with your future line manager (either in person or online) and someone from HR to talk about you, our culture, and whether you're a fit for the job.

4. Assignment & Second interview: Some roles involve a case study. Great! It’s your chance to shine and show us you have what it takes. You’ll present your case study to the Hiring Manager and someone from the team

5. Third Interview: You’ll meet with a key member of the management team

6. Offer: You did it! There are only a few tickets available, and this one has your name on it. Welcome to the team!

Find out more about our company culture, values and big wins at company.recharge.com and our Instagram Page on Lifeatrecharge or meet some of our team in the video below.

Proactive acquisition from 3rd parties is not appreciated.

job_titles: PhD in Artificial Intelligence for predictive maintenance in water and electricity infrastructure
job_description:
Oss, Noord-Brabant
Squadra Machine Learning Company is een vernieuwend Nederlands bedrijf wat kennis over bedrijfsprocessen, data mining, statistiek en data visualisatie combineert met als doel klanten te helpen met machine learning algoritmes en het toepassen van kunstmatige intelligentie. We hebben een passie voor Data Science en Machine Learning in het bijzonder. Machine Learning is een krachtige techniek waardoor software intelligente taken kan uitvoeren die tot voor kort voornamelijk door mensen uitgevoerd werden. Daarmee helpen we onze klanten diverse bedrijfs- en industriële processen, klantgerichte diensten en andere data gedreven functies op een vernieuwende wijze te automatiseren

Wie ben jij?
Je bent in het bezit van een WO-diploma in richting van kunstmatige intelligentie, wiskunde, econometrie of een andere analytische studie.
Je hebt uitgebreide kennis van Python.
Je hebt ervaring in het toepassen van big data-oplossingen in de praktijk
Je bent bekend met Cloud platformen, zoals Azure/AWS.
Wat bieden wij jou?
Kansen om mee te groeien in ons bedrijf voor een langere periode.
Marktconform salaris.
Iedere middag een verzorgde lunch.
Maandelijkse teambuilding en gezamenlijke activiteiten.

PhD in Artificial Intelligence to support Sustainable Development Goals 6 (clean water) and 7 (clean energy) as part of the Innovation Lab for Utilities on Sustainable Technology and Renewable Energy (ILUSTRE) project, funded in a public private partnership by NWO/NLAIC and private partners.

PhD in Artificial Intelligence for predictive maintenance in water and electricity infrastructure (ILUSTRE)

The Jheronimus Academy of Data Science (JADS) is the joint Data Science Academy of Tilburg University and Eindhoven University of Technology, the Netherlands.

JADS is seeking an enthusiastic colleague for the position of

PhD researcher in Artificial Intelligence for predictive maintenance in water and electricity infrastructure,
as part of the ILUSTRE project that focusses on use-cases in the Caribbean region.

Short Description
Are you interested in building deep learning solutions to achieve real-time-based predictive maintenance algorithms for real-world applications? In this project, you will be exploring unsupervised and self-supervised learning methods. Moreover, you will have the possibility to test the results of your work with water and energy providers. This position is part of a collaboration between several industrial and academic partners.

Job Description
Predictive maintenance offers great potential value to the energy and water supply industry. Timely detection of required maintenance of machines, sensors, or other critical infrastructure can prevent service disruptions and costly loss of resources. For instance, visual sensors can be used to analyze and detect subtle patterns, and auditory sensors can pick up subtle sound changes.
Artificial intelligence allows for improved prediction performance on predictive maintenance tasks. However, one of the main challenges is dealing with real-time-based predictive maintenance. Instead of treating predictive maintenance as a simple alert monitoring, real-time-based predictive maintenance offers an estimate of time-to-failure. You will be addressing this challenge by working with large amounts of unlabeled visual and auditory datasets to create models for continuous and reliable monitoring of system states that can accurately predict time-to-failure. You will work on deep learning solutions to achieve real-time-based predictive maintenance algorithms. These models will be based on unsupervised and self-supervised learning, and you will work with both discriminative and generative models. Moreover, you will study the accuracy, reliability, and possible integration of these models with water and energy providers and other industrial partners.

Your work will contribute to achieving a more reliable distribution of energy and water and to the more general goal of building robust machine learning for a sustainable society. You will be part of the Jheronimus Academy of Data Science in ‘s-Hertogenbosch and closely collaborate with Tilburg University and the Eindhoven University of Technology.

ILUSTRE project
This position is linked to ILUSTRE, a new Innovation Center for Artificial Intelligence (ICAI) to be established in Curaçao. ILUSTRE will be a living lab in the Caribbean with the objective to develop, implement and test AI innovations that will accelerate the use of clean energy and advanced solutions in water treatment and wastewater recycling/purification. The innovation lab is one of the new ICAI labs that are part of the ROBUST program on Trustworthy AI-based Systems for Sustainable Growth which is financed under the NWO LTP funding scheme. ILUSTRE offers opportunities for PhD candidates who wish to support to the acceleration of the energy transition and who have an affinity with the Dutch Caribbean islands.

Job Requirements
We are looking for candidates that meet the following criteria:
A master’s degree in artificial intelligence, data science, computer science or an equivalent quantitative field.
Provable affinity with the Caribbean region.
Preparedness to perform a significant part of the research in the Caribbean region.
A research-oriented attitude.
Ability to work in a team while also taking a pro-active attitude to drive your own research in collaboration with industrial partners and other stakeholders.
Fluent in spoken and written English (C1 level).

Conditions of Employment
Being appointed at JADS provides a meaningful job in a dynamic and ambitious community of two universities and many startups. Based on the project, the candidate receives an appointment at Tilburg University.

As a PhD Student at JADS you will have a full-time employment for a total of four years, with an intermediate evaluation after nine months. JADS offers excellent employment conditions with attention to flexibility and (personal) development and attractive fringe benefits. The gross monthly salary is in accordance with the Collective Labor Agreement for Dutch Universities. The minimum gross salary is  2.541 per month up to a maximum of  3.247 in the fourth year. The selected candidate will start with a contract for one year. Upon a positive outcome of the first-year evaluation, the candidate will be offered an employment contract for the remaining three years. You are entitled to a vacation allowance of 8% and a year-end bonus of 8.3% of your gross annual income. If you work 40 hours per week, you will receive 41 paid days of leave per year. PhD Students from outside the Netherlands may qualify for a tax-free allowance of 30% of their taxable salary if they meet the relevant conditions. The university applies for this allowance on their behalf. JADS will provide assistance in finding suitable accommodation.

The exact conditions of employment may vary depending on the percentage of time spent in Curaçao as part of your secondment.

Preferred starting date: September 1, 2023.

To develop your teaching skills, you will spend 10% of your employment on teaching tasks. To support you during your PhD and to prepare you for the rest of your career, you will make a Training and Supervision plan and you will have free access to a personal development program for PhD students.

Next to that we offer all kinds of facilities and arrangements to maintain an optimal balance between work and private life. All employees of the university are covered by the so-called General Pension Fund for Public Employers (Stichting Pensioenfonds ABP).

JADS values an open and inclusive culture. We embrace diversity and encourage the mutual integration of groups of employees and students. We focus on creating equal opportunities for all our employees and students so that everyone feels at home in our university community.
All researchers working in JADS have contracts at either Tilburg University or Eindhoven University of Technology. Please visit Working at Tilburg University and Working at Eindhoven University of Technology for more information on their respective employment conditions.

More information
Do you recognize yourself in this profile and would you like to know more? Please contact prof. dr. Eric Postma (E.O.Postma@jads.edu).
For information about terms of employment, please contact HR@JADS.nl.

Application
We invite you to submit a complete application by using the 'apply now'-button on this page. The application should include a:
Cover letter in which you describe your motivation and qualifications for the position.
Curriculum vitae, including a list of your publications and the contact information of three references.
Brief description of your MSc thesis.

We look forward to receiving your application before June 30th, 2023. Interviews will be planned between July 3rd, 2023 and July 14th, 2023. The screening will continue until the position has been filled.

JADS heeft drie campussen in Tilburg, Eindhoven en ’s Hertogenbosch. JADS Campus in Den Bosch draait om onderzoek, onderwijs en valorisatie van data-ondernemerschap.

Ben je goed in het maken van Computer Vision Models en vind je het leuk om het team data scientisten hierin verder te coachen?
Kom snel kennis maken!
Afdelingsinformatie
De afdeling Data Management (Asset Management) is dé plek waar data en engineering samenkomen. Hier wordt data ingewonnen en er worden producten gemaakt waar onze Asset Managers en Port Engineers met smart op zitten te wachten. Onze producten ondersteunen hen bij operationele én strategische beslissingen.

De haven van de toekomst die zowel slim als duurzaam is, daar kan jij aan meewerken bij Havenbedrijf Rotterdam. De opgave is gigantisch en er is enorm veel te doen op het gebied van de organisatie data gedreven maken.
Van het door middel van data science modellen optimaliseren van het asset management proces, tot het analyseren van sensordata van onze infrastructuur en het maken van computer vision models voor het automatiseren van onze inspecties: de projecten zijn uiteenlopend en hebben direct impact op onze operatie.
Binnen Asset Management zoeken wij een Senior Data Scientist die samen met ons de haven van de toekomst een stap dichterbij brengt en daarnaast de collega data scientisten begeleidt.
Wat ga je doen?
Eén groot project waar je je mee bezig zult houden is het waarmaken van de kreet ‘de inspecteur van de toekomst is een sensor’. Dit doe je door het maken en verbeteren van computer vision models in een klein agile team bestaande uit een Product Owner, Data Engineers en Data Scientists.
Jij gaat met behulp van jouw ML-engineering expertise dit project verder in productie brengen en onderhouden, en de juiste koers laten varen.
Je speelt zelf een grote rol in welke projecten worden gestart, middels het ophalen, valideren en (indien de validatie geslaagd is,) implementeren van nieuwe ideeën van onze Asset Managers en Port Engineers. Dit doe je door meerdere keren per jaar de haven in te gaan en het gesprek aan te gaan met onze Asset Managers.
Naast het zelf toepassen van data science heb je een coachende en leidende rol binnen het Data Science team van Data Management en je pakt die rol ook binnen de gehele Havenbedrijf Data Science community. De Data Scientists van het Havenbedrijf werken verspreid over de verschillende afdelingen, en ontmoeten elkaar maandelijks om elkaar te inspireren en samen te werken in hackathons.
Door jouw kennis van data science kun jij andere Data Scientists inspireren en motiveren.
Wat vragen wij van jou?
Als Senior Data Scientist binnen Data Management blink jij uit in het analyseren van een probleem of klantvraag, en het bepalen van een pragmatische en effectieve oplosrichting op het data science spectrum. Veranderende omstandigheden of wensen van de klant zijn voor jou geen probleem. Jij staat vanwege jouw inzicht en ervaring sterk in je schoenen, en bent daardoor assertief en in staat anderen te coachen.
Belangrijk is nog meer:
Een afgeronde WO-opleiding Artificial Intelligence, Computer/Data Science, Econometrie of een gerelateerde technische universitaire opleiding
Ten minste 5 jaar ervaring als Data Scientist, en aantoonbare ervaring met het leiden van data science projecten
Aantoonbare kennis van Python/R en Apache Spark
Aantoonbare kennis van statistiek en machine learning
Aantoonbare ervaring met het in productie brengen van data science modellen.
Je spreekt Nederlands en Engels
Ervaring met Cloud platformen (bij voorkeur Azure)
Ervaring met de Agile werkwijze is een pre
Ervaring met IoT en time series analyses is een pre

How does Optiver accurately price hundreds of thousands of interconnected financial products in real-time? In one word: data. Our Data Analyst teams tackle fascinating challenges that exist at the intersection of technology and trading - a space with some of the most complex and exciting volumes of financial market data. With world-class skills that can cut through the noise, Optiver's Data Analyst teams directly impact the precision and scalability of our 35+ year trading business.

Optiver's Data Analysts collaborate with Traders, Data Engineers, Quantitative Researchers and Technologists to perform in-depth data analysis. They sit on our buzzing Trading floor - the heartbeat of the business - to share their market insights with our Traders, Quantitative Researchers and Developers. As a Data Analyst, your observations and recommendations will be highly valued, and trusted to inform crucial trading decisions, including identifying new trading opportunities. This makes you a key player in our market activities, whose impact can be felt in real time.


WHO WE ARE:

Optiver is a tech-driven trading firm and leading global market maker. As one of the oldest market making institutions, we are a trusted partner of 50+ exchanges across the globe. Our mission is to constantly improve the market by injecting liquidity, providing accurate pricing, increasing transparency and acting as a stabilising force no matter the market conditions. With a focus on continuous improvement, we participate in the safeguarding of healthy and efficient markets for everyone who participates.

Our Amsterdam office is where it all began. Over 35 years ago, Optiver's business started with a single trader on the floor of Amsterdam's European Stock Exchange. Since our 1986 founding, Optiver's Amsterdam office has grown into one of the most dynamic and exciting trading floors in Europe. Our culture reflects the Dutch capital city's progressive, innovative and inclusive nature. With its unique spirit, Amsterdam is the ideal hub for our teams to trade a wide range of products from listed derivatives to cash equities, ETFs, bonds and foreign exchange.


WHAT YOU'LL DO:

Being a Data Analyst at Optiver is not just about analysing data. You will be the key person who transforms raw market data into concise, actionable information. By viewing trading strategy inefficiencies through a structured, statistical lens, you'll enable us to improve our results. You will also be responsible for developing our data analysis application, which provides large-scale, real-time strategy analysis.

No two days are the same on the Data Analyst Team. Your work will be dynamic and ever-evolving, with a mixture of short and long-term projects. You can expect to:

Analyse and transform terabytes of raw market and trading data
Provide the Trading team with new insights that improve their strategies or automate their tasks
Use data analysis to detect and evaluate unwanted trading patterns and assess potential risks
Streamline data pipelines, conducting modelling and make visualisations
Build, own, maintain and further develop different interactive trading applications
Write and test code for several ongoing projects
Continuously broaden your technical horizon and stay up-to-date with the latest technology
WHO YOU ARE:

The feedback loop for this team is immediate, therefore we look for dynamic and highly ambitious people who seek to constantly innovate, challenge the status quo and want to work alongside some of the most talented and intelligent people in the business.

In terms of skills and qualifications, we're looking for:

Academic degree in a STEM related area: e.g. Math, Statistics, Data Science, Computer science, Engineering, Econometrics etc.
Advanced knowledge of Python experience with scientific Python stack (e.g. Pandas, Numpy and SciPy)
Problem solving mindset
Proactive, can-do attitude
Eagerness to learn
Strong communicator: you need to able to translate your ideas to different areas of the business


WHAT YOU'LL GET:

The chance to start your career working alongside best-in-class professionals from over 40 different countries.

Alongside this you will get great secondary benefits such as 25 paid vacation days, fully paid first-class commuting expenses, training opportunities, discounts on health insurance, breakfast and lunch facilities, sports and leisure activities, Friday afternoon drinks and even weekly in-house chair massages. Being highly international, we are accustomed to guiding expats through their relocation, offering competitive relocation packages and providing visa sponsorship where necessary.


HOW TO APPLY & LOCAL PRIVACY STATEMENT
Are you interested in furthering your career on one of the most dynamic and exciting trading floors in Europe?

Apply directly via the form below for the position of Data Analyst Please provide us with a CV and letter of motivation in English. Applications without a letter of motivation will not be reviewed. When we think there is a potential match, you will hear from us sooner than you expect. If you have any questions feel free to contact Recruitment team at recruitment@Optiver.com.

Please note, if you are selected from your application to proceed to the next round for the position of Data Analyst, you will be required to take an online assessment.

Kindly note that we do not require any assistance from third-parties including agencies in the recruitment of this role


DIVERSITY STATEMENT:
As an intentionally flat organisation, we believe that great ideas and impact can come from everyone. We are passionate about empowering individuals and creating diverse teams that thrive. Every person at Optiver should feel included, valued and respected, because we believe our best work is done together.

Our commitment to diversity and inclusion is hardwired through every stage of our hiring process. We encourage applications from candidates from any and all backgrounds, and we welcome requests for reasonable adjustments during the process to ensure that you can best demonstrate your abilities.

More information on how Optiver Europe processes your personal data can be found in our Privacy Policy.

Important note: Within a week of submitting your application you will receive an online assessment, if eligible. You will have a short timeframe to complete the assessment. By submitting your application you are confirming that you will be able to take the assessment within 5 days

We accept one application per role, per year. If you have applied to this role across any of our offices in the last year and have been unsuccessful, you can reapply once your 12 month cooling period has concluded.
