Wat ga je doen als Data Scientist / Analist ?

Wil jij als Data Scientist of Data Analist een bijdrage leveren aan de energietransitie in Nederland? De energiemarkt verandert razendsnel en onze klanten lopen hierin voorop. Binnen de openstaande Data Scientist of Analist vacature zorg jij dat deze
transitie van de grond komt.

Ons doel is om een belangrijke bijdrage te leveren aan deze digitale transformatie. Om dit te realiseren ga jij als Data Scientist of als Analist aan de slag met uitdagingen als predictive maintenance, vergroten van inzicht in energiebesparende maatregelen en klantgedrag, fraudedetectie, voorspellen van energieverbruik en/of opwek en smart charging (elektrisch vervoer).

Infiniot werkt aan maatschappelijke impact

Bij Infiniot hebben we een strategische focus op energie & duurzaamheid. Wij zetten onze consultants in bij dynamische klanten die werken aan innovatieve oplossingen binnen de energietransitie en de vitale infrastructuur. Hierin werken wij aan projecten die maatschappelijke impact maken. Binnen ons team hebben wij een gevarieerde mix van data en software professionals die een hoge technische expertise in huis hebben.

De onderlinge binding van ons team en het behouden hiervan is dan ook een grote prioriteit. Binnen onze organisatie zijn de lijntjes kort, wat ervoor zorgt dat wij snel in staat zijn om te schakelen en gemakkelijk onze kennis met elkaar delen. Hierin speelt ook de vitaliteit van onze medewerkers en duurzame mobiliteit een belangrijke rol. Denk aan elektrisch rijden, reizen met het OV en de bijdrage aan kennisontwikkeling op bijvoorbeeld scholen.

Direct solliciteren op deze Data Scientist of Analist vacature?

Als Data Scientist / Analist zul je Businesstoepassingen analysieren en datasets analyseren, complexe data inzichtelijk maken in dashboard of ander relevante inzichten Al Data Scientist zul je bovendien bruikbare Machine Learning & AI modellen creëren, zodat je met Data Science of Data Anlayse toegevoegde waarde kan leveren door het verschaffen van nieuwe inzichten.

Daarnaast krijg je met jouw overtuigingskracht en enthousiasme je omgeving mee op het gebied van data analytics. Als Data Scientist of Data Analist werk je daarbij veel samen met onze Data Engineers.

K-Konnekt B.V. is de IT-Hub van een groot Duits familiebedrijf in de automotive industrie. Ons team werkt uitsluitend voor dit familiebedrijf dat wereldwijd meer dan 8.000 medewerkers telt verdeeld over 10 locaties. Als IT-Hub zijn onze medewerkers in alle IT-Deelgebieden werkzaam, of het gaat om IT Infrastructuur, Cybersecurity of Data- en Analytics wij bieden ondersteuning. De werksfeer is zeer familiair en ons team maakt deel uit van het 100 man grote wereldwijde IT-Team.Als Data Engineer maak je deel uit van het Applications Data & Analytics Team en bestaan je werkzaamheden onder andere uit volgende taken:Je ontwikkelt, implementeerd of onderhoud dataflows en -modellen binnen ons ETL Process.Je ontwikkelt, implementeerd of onderhoud visualisaties, dashboards en rapporten.Je bent de spil met de andere afdelingen waar het gaat om de requirementsanalyse en data analyse.Je werkt aan een schaalbare data architectuur met focus op verschillende thema's waaronde data warehousing, data science en IoT-projecten.De vereisten die we stellen aan de kandidaten zijn de volgende, waarbij we een eventuele deficiëntie in de basiskennis van de Duitse taal bereid zijn bij te scholen:Succesvol afgeronde HBO/WO opleiding (bijvoorbeeld: bedrijfskundige informatica, informatica) of relevante werkervaring,Kennis van bedrijfsprocessen.Kennis van SAP is een pre.Microsoft Azure Data Factory en Synapse Analytics is gewenst.Kennis van verschillende modelleertechnieken, waaronder Data Lake, Data Lakehouse en Stermodellen.Power BI of vergelijkbare visualisatie software.Zelfstandige werkhouding, het nemen van verantwoording en het ondersteunen van colega's zijn belangrijk binnen K-Konnekt.Spreekt vloeiend Engels (C1)Basiskennis van het Duits (B1)Af en toe reizen naar de buitenlandse locaties (wereldwijd)Binnen K-Konnekt wordt inclusiviteit in de praktijk gebracht en doen we er alles aan dat ons team zich thuis voelt. Nieuwsgierig geworden? We nodigen je van harte uit om zelf te komen kijken en de sfeer te proeven.Soort dienstverband: Fulltime, Parttime, Vaste baanParttime uren: 40 per weekSalaris: 4.000,00 - 6.500,00 per maandFlexibele taalvereiste:Nederlands niet vereistSoorten aanvullende vergoedingen:VakantiegeldOpleiding:Bachelor (Gewenst)Ervaring:Azure: 3 jaar (Vereist)Toestemming om te werken:Netherlands (Vereist)Werklocatie: Hybride werken in 3454 PV Utrecht

Introduction
Are you about to graduate or did you graduate in the past year? Are you a forward-thinker and eager to learn? At IBM Consulting we are always looking for superstars to work on multiple exciting projects, in a friendly and energetic working environment. If that is you, join us as an Associate Consultant!


IBM Consulting’s Associate Programme is IBM’s world-class 2-year development programme for early professionals and about-to-graduate talents.

As an Associate you will jump-start your consulting career by combining client project work across different industries and service areas. Your projects will be combined with focused training and coaching by our network of experts and mentors. All those elements will help you develop relevant skills and gain meaningful experience, while you solve our clients’ most challenging problems with future-shaping solutions. Learn more here:
https://www.ibm.com/services/careers/entry-level-consultant

Your Role and Responsibilities

As an Associate Consultant you will work directly with our clients on key initiatives. You will have the opportunity to build an in-depth understanding of their business issues and implement organizational strategies that drive adoption of change. We are looking for talents who can build credibility and trust with our clients and provide knowledge that addresses individual and unique business needs.
We foster a culture of creative, innovative thinkers; people who are curious about how technology can transform businesses and impact the world. We cultivate a diverse, inclusive, global team of people who want to pioneer, re-imagine and disrupt the future.
If you see yourself as someone who believes no problem is too big to solve, and who wants to unleash their potential, IBM Consulting is for you.
You’re right at the intersection of technology, people, and process, helping your clients transform how they adapt to shifts in the market, and more closely align their business strategy and vision. Associate Consultants are important and key players for our clients. You’ll be their guide to developing an understanding of their processes, goals and objectives to define their future state, then help them get there.
You’ll help clients understand leading technologies and the impact they can have on traditional business processes. You’ll have an opportunity to build a powerful portfolio of interesting and rewarding experiences, taking advantage of opportunities to master new skills, learning about and becoming an expert in our client’s industries, and tackle new challenges.
Within your role as an Associate consultant in Data Services you will:Define requirements and implement data management solutions in an Agile project environmentDevelop technical as well as business expertise in the data management domain and share this with colleagues and clientsContribute to further growth of IBM Data Platform Services by contributing to business development activitiesFocus on the latest evolutions in helping our clients’ business by defining and setting up cloud data platforms which can be used for AI and Data Monetization, taking into account privacy and security requirements.Work in client service environment and gain expertise in the planning, design, management, execution, and reporting of establishing a modern data platform. Be part of driving data transformation journeys where clients become data driven enterprises. Create core data platform components to enable distinctive, lasting, and substantial business improvements for our clients.Advise, design, and provide implementation support for data solutions on virtualized and cloud- based environments including hosted and on-premise solutions.
Recruitment process
If you’re interested in this position, please follow the following steps:Apply via our career site and upload your CV and motivation letter (in English)Talent Acquisition team will follow up with your application within the next weeksThe most suitable candidates will be invited to an Assessment Day beginning of June where you will spend the day with similar minded graduates.
The vacancy will be closed end of May 2023
Expected Start Dates for the new hires are 1 September 2023

Work location for this role is Amsterdam, Netherlands.

Required Technical and Professional Expertise
Master’s degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, Data Science, Business Economics, Business & Management or related studiesWe welcome recent graduates with maximum 1 year of work experience and final-year students with less than 6 months of studies left.Fluent in Dutch (min level B2) and English with strong communication skills both verbally and in writingWillingness to travel up to 4 days a week to clients in NLEligible to work in the Netherlands and European Union without any restrictionProfessional and conscientious attitudeGood presentation skills

Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise


About Business Unit
IBM Consulting is IBM’s consulting and global professional services business, with market leading capabilities in business and technology transformation. With deep expertise in many industries, we offer strategy, experience, technology, and operations services to many of the most innovative and valuable companies in the world. Our people are focused on accelerating our clients’ businesses through the power of collaboration. We believe in the power of technology responsibly used to help people, partners and the planet.

Your Life @ IBM
In a world where technology never stands still, we understand that, dedication to our clients success, innovation that matters, and trust and personal responsibility in all our relationships, lives in what we do as IBMers as we strive to be the catalyst that makes the world work better.
Being an IBMer means you’ll be able to learn and develop yourself and your career, you’ll be encouraged to be courageous and experiment everyday, all whilst having continuous trust and support in an environment where everyone can thrive whatever their personal or professional background.
Our IBMers are growth minded, always staying curious, open to feedback and learning new information and skills to constantly transform themselves and our company. They are trusted to provide on-going feedback to help other IBMers grow, as well as collaborate with colleagues keeping in mind a team focused approach to include different perspectives to drive exceptional outcomes for our customers. The courage our IBMers have to make critical decisions everyday is essential to IBM becoming the catalyst for progress, always embracing challenges with resources they have to hand, a can-do attitude and always striving for an outcome focused approach within everything that they do.
About IBM
IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.

Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we’re also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business.


At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it’s time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.

Location Statement

Being You @ IBM

job_titles: PhD- Visual Analytics for Multimodal Data and Trustworthy Evidence in Court
job_description:
What do we offer?
To be courageous
To live wholeheartedly
To keep growing
What do you bring?
Passion for your expertise
Passion for data
High focus on quality
How you can

make a difference
For our IT Risk & Control team at Business Services Finance Europe, we are looking for an additional colleague with Data & Analytics knowledge. Do you combine your technical expertise with a continuous drive to identify risks and strengthen our internal European control framework? Then this is your next job!
The job itself
As Risk Data Engineer, you will be responsible to leverage big data and cloud infrastructure to aggregate and structure data, monitor the quality of data, build integration layers between data sources and learning models, and ultimately detect risks and control weaknesses.
The different EU AD Brands have a lot of data from different sources out disposal. Your challenge is accessing those and bringing them to life, for the purposes of your colleagues who can easily interpret and use them for controlling and/or in preparation of an on-site visit.
With your D&A expertise, applied to Risk Management, you make an impact by:
Analyzing and translating the needs into technical specifications
Exploring, analyzing, preparing, and modelling data
Solving data integration, data modelling, and data visualization complications
Translating technical concepts into business understanding and value
Improving reporting and data visualization capabilities
Supporting the remediation of data-driven issue
Engaging across the IT function and data community to identify and build new data sources
Working with various stakeholders to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs.
Working with data and analytics experts in the wider data community to strive for greater functionality in data systems
Your new office
The IT Risk & Control EU team is part of Business Services Finance. The team is focused on the European activities. Risk & Control provides 2nd line assurance on the Internal Control Framework in the three lines of defense structure of Ahold Delhaize.
You will execute your activities across Europe and be in contact with all local R&C and Store Audit teams.
The Manager IT Risk & Control EU is based in our office in Belgium. The R&C specialists and store auditors are located in our EU offices. For this position, we are flexible for the location which can be in one of our EU offices (CZ, GR, RO, SRB, NL or BE). Travel will be required in other EU countries this will be 20% of the time.
What do we offer?
Here at Ahold Delhaize we aim to grow. This is only possible if you grow along with us. That’s why we help you take your career and personal development in the direction you want to. Besides this, we offer the following:
being part of a young and dynamic team and part of the second line of defense.
the chance to work with a European team of experienced people. You will work with great colleagues who will be able to support and coach you, so you can develop your skills.
a variety of tasks, where every day is different and where you can take on responsibilities yourself
you will receive an attractive salary adapted to your experience.
Requirements
At Ahold Delhaize, you’ll be working for one of the biggest retailers in the world. You are bursting with ambition to keep up with us. And specifically, for this vacancy as Risk Data Engineer, you supplement these skills with:
University degree in Computer Science, Information Technology
Work experience of minimum 1 to 7 years in Data Analytics, Big Data, AI or Data Science.
A fluency in English (both written and verbally); other relevant languages are considered an advantage.
Greater experience in Power BI is mandatory. Alteryx, Tableau, Databricks, SAP BI are a plus.
Experience with programming in SQL or Python, Cloud Technology (MS Azure) are a plus
Analytical skills, process minded, logical insights and ability to think critically
Excellent planning and time management skills
Excellent communication skills
Effective project management skills
A passion for data and disruptive technologies.
As a person you also have the following key competences. You:
are a team player with good communication and influencing skills.
are able to use your strong analytical skills to understand and challenge processes, to keep the helicopter overview and to be able to make proposals / advice on control implementation or improvements.
are flexible and possess good time management skills, since you deal with a large quantity of data.
are able to work autonomously.
Apply now
Seeing is believing. This is true in our stores, as well as in our offices. It could be your new workplace, where you, as Risk Data Engineer, have influence over the most renowned retail markets in Europe.
Would you like to learn more first before applying? Peter Dirks, Talent Acquisition Partner Data, can tell you a lot more about this position via peter.dirks@ah.nl
What
matters to us?
Ahold Delhaize is one of the world’s largest food retail groups and a leader in both supermarkets and e-commerce. Together, we help people eat well, save time and live better - it’s how we make a difference. And we do it because we care: for our customers, our people and the world around us.
Be courageous
"I realized how much impact you can truly have as an individual, working for such a huge international company.”
Live wholeheartedly
“The support this company has always offered means the world to me."
Keep growing
“I feel the freedom to show initiative, propose changes and try new things. Having that freedom gave me wings to fly.”

Job description
We are looking for a motivated PhD candidate that wants to develop new Visualization and Visual Analytics methods for the exploration, analysis, and interpretability of multimodal evidence data.
Law enforcement is faced with huge amounts of data from online platforms, digital marketplaces, and communication services. Finding evidence in such large collections of text, images, and other data and bringing it to court is a time-consuming process. Artificial Intelligence tools are a promising way to make this more efficient and effective. But currently, no clear legal regulations for AI tools are in place. In AI4Intelligence we let AI tool development, the use of the tools by investigators, and legal regulations go hand-in-hand so investigations lead to trustworthy evidence that is admissible in court.
The candidate is expected to research and develop Visualization and Visual Analytics methods to increase model transparency and provide explanations to ensure trustworthy evidence from multimodal data. He/she develops novel Visualization and Visual Analytics tools & techniques:
To explain AI model predictions for both the data scientist and non-technical stakeholders; and
For multimodal data exploration, hypothesis generation, testing, and link discovery, using a (hyper)graph/network analysis approach.

In this project, the focus is on the Visualization for multimodal data exploration, and the Visualization of novel AI algorithms that are developed by other collaborators in the project.
The project is performed within the Visualization cluster under the supervision of Dr.ir. Stef van den Elzen and Prof.dr. Anna Vilanova. This position is part of the NWO KIC AI4Intelligence project with collaborators from universities (University of Amsterdam, Utrecht University, VU Amsterdam, University of Applied Sciences Leiden, University of Applied Sciences The Hague), government (Netherlands National Police, Netherlands Forensic Institute), and industry (Microsoft, TNO, Sustainable Rescue Foundation, SynerScope, CFLW Cyber Strategies, DuckDuck-Goose, ZiuZ Forensics BV, BG.legal). The project brings together scientific scholars from Computer Science (UvA,UU,TU/e), management (UU), and law (VU) which are an essential combination to address the challenges posed. Within computer science three related, but complementary perspectives on data, its analysis, and exploration are present in the consortium. Data-driven Machine Learning (UvA), Knowledge Driven AI (UU), and Visual Analytics (TU/e). The researchers from the different disciplines will all work on two use cases bringing in their own expertise, continuously building upon the achievements of others, and influencing the research of others.
The visualization cluster (https://research.tue.nl/en/organisations/visualization-3) at TU/e has a strong track record in visualization and visual analytics for ML models and high-dimensional data. It has generated several award-winning contributions at major visualization conferences (IEEE VIS, IEEE InfoVis, IEEE VAST, EuroVis); several successful start-up companies (MagnaView - now UiPath and SynerScope); and a number of techniques that are used on a large scale worldwide.

Job requirements
We are looking for a candidate who meets the following requirements:
You are enthusiastic about research in Visual Analytics, Multimodal Data, and Explainable AI.
You have experience with or a strong background in Visualization or Visual Analytics. Preferably you finished a master’s in Computer Science, (Applied) Mathematics, or Electrical Engineering.
Expertise in the field of Explainable AI is a plus but not mandatory.
You have strong programming skills in object-oriented GUI languages (Qt/C++, Java, Python,..).
You have good communication skills and are able to work in a multidisciplinary team.
You are creative, critical, analytical, hardworking, and persistent.
You have a good command of the English language (knowledge of Dutch is not required).
Conditions of employment
A meaningful job in a dynamic and ambitious university, in an interdisciplinary setting and within an international network. You will work on a beautiful, green campus within walking distance of the central train station. In addition, we offer you:
Full-time employment for four years, with an intermediate evaluation (go/no-go) after nine months. You will spend 10% of your employment on teaching tasks.
Salary and benefits (such as a pension scheme, paid pregnancy and maternity leave, partially paid parental leave) in accordance with the Collective Labour Agreement for Dutch Universities, scale 27 (min. 2,541 max. 3,247).
A year-end bonus of 8.3% and annual vacation pay of 8%.
High-quality training programs and other support to grow into a self-aware, autonomous scientific researcher. At TU/e we challenge you to take charge of your own learning process.
An excellent technical infrastructure, on-campus children's day care and sports facilities.
An allowance for commuting, working from home and internet costs.
A Staff Immigration Team and a tax compensation scheme (the 30% facility) for international candidates.
Information and application
About us
Eindhoven University of Technology is an internationally top-ranking university in the Netherlands that combines scientific curiosity with a hands-on attitude. Our spirit of collaboration translates into an open culture and a top-five position in collaborating with advanced industries. Fundamental knowledge enables us to design solutions for the highly complex problems of today and tomorrow.

Curious to hear more about what it’s like as a PhD candidate at TU/e? Please view the video.

Information
Do you recognize yourself in this profile and would you like to know more?
Please contact dr.ir. Stef van den Elzen (s.j.v.d.elzen[at]tue.nl).
Visit our website for more information about the application process or the conditions of employment. You can also contact HR Services, HRServices.MCS[at]tue.nl.
Are you inspired and would like to know more about working at TU/e? Please visit our career page.
Application
We invite you to submit a complete application by using the apply button.
he application should include a:
Cover letter in which you describe your motivation and qualifications for the position.
Curriculum vitae, including a list of your publications and the contact information of three references.
We look forward to receiving your application and will screen it as soon as possible. The vacancy will remain open until the position is filled.

job_titles: Data Solution Architect / Principal Data Engineer
job_description:
We are looking for a Data Analyst/Engineer in Utrecht, Netherlands.
Reports to: Head of Product Operations 
Intellerts is an innovative company. Our goal is to help the business stay ahead of its competitors using Artificial Intelligence (AI) tools. We love to maximize the potential of AI and Data Science. Applying AI requires extensive Data Science expertise we harvest the true value of Big Data. Every day, we translate AI technologies and AI research into new business assets. Three core values drive our company and team culture: mastery — being good at what we do (the pursuit of mastery), autonomy — the ability to decide how we do what we do (right to self-organize and self-govern), and purpose - to have a clear understanding of why we do what we do. As a Data Analyst/Engineer, you‘ll be part of our AIFA project development team and will turn data into information, information into insight and insight into business decisions, and monitor performance and quality control plans to identify improvements. The AIFA project aims to create an ecosystem of finance and audit analytics designed to automate business, financial and internal audit activities using advanced artificial intelligence (AI), machine training (ML), and big data technologies. With the team of experienced specialists, you will develop a modern, multifaceted, integrated, and modular platform for data management and analytics to enable business organizations, financial experts, banks, accountants, business consultants, auditors, and data scientists to create finance, business productivity management, and internal audit data products. You are responsible for: Create, maintain and optimize data pipeline architecture; Build on large complex data sets that meet functional/non-functional requirements set by business; Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements. With your creativity, you will automate manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability where needed; Build and maintain data pipeline infrastructures for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using SQL, PostgreSQL, and cloud-based technologies like Azure, AWS, Google Cloud; Work with clients, data and analytics experts to improve our data systems and deliver richer functionalities to our clients; Use advanced computerized models to extract the data needed and remove corrupted data; Perform initial analysis to assess the quality of the data; Working alongside teams within the business or the management team to establish business needs; Define new data collection and analysis processes. To succeed in this role, you should have the following skills and experience: Expert knowledge in programming languages: SQL or have a good understanding of data manipulation using PostgreSQL or Microsoft SQL DBMS; Expert in relational database design and concepts; Knowledge of Python, R (preferable); Experience in data models and reporting packages; Strong verbal and written communication skills; An analytical mind and inclination for problem-solving; A high level of mathematical ability and a methodical and logical approach; Problem-solving skills; The ability to plan work and meet deadlines; Accuracy and attention to detail; Dutch language skills, A2 level or above.In return, we offer you: Autonomy to define how you are going to do work; Flexible working hours, ability to work from home, and professional development; The opportunity to grow in your field in an international company;The opportunity to learn from professionals; Excellent environment to expand your knowledge and skills; Holiday pay (8%) Holidays - 27 days per year Pension arrangement - Employer contribution of 50% of the pension premium We are a team with challenging goals.
Join us, and let’s reach the company and your personal goals together. Let’s talk! To apply, please send your CV and cover letter to j.dobrovolskiene@intellerts.com 
Only selected candidates will be informed about the further process

Introduction to the job
Are you the hands-on experienced data solution architect that can design, align, implement and maintain complex
Big Data architectures? Are you able to apply the cutting-edge technologies and tools to (help) build Big Data

pipelines? Do you want to be enable business value generation from data by defining and designing our big data

environments and elevating our best practices on data engineering, then read on!
Job mission
As a Data Solution Architect & Principal Data Engineer you will apply the latest technologies and tools to define

and design complex Big Data platform architectures and solutions. You will be closely working with

domain/technical experts, IT/platform architects, Product Owners, software developers, data scientists and data

engineers to drive successful implementation and maintenance of cutting-edge data-driven software solutions. On

top of your profound technical capabilities, your success will strongly dependent on your interpersonal skills and

your ability to communicate across disciplines. You will engage in evaluation of alternative solutions and fuel our

Technical Competence by introducing and defining best practices in Big Data Engineering, MLOps and Architecting.
Within ASML, the sector Development & Engineering is responsible for the development, specification

and design of new ASML products. Within Development & Engineering, the Software Data department delivers and advances state-of-the-art methods and techniques for the structural improvement of the performance and quality of scanner

components via Predictive Maintenance and Diagnostics/Prognostics solutions.The holder of this position reports to the manager of Predictive Maintenance & Diagnostics group and will participate in the Data Engineering Technical Competence
Role and responsibilities
You will be working in a multi-disciplinary environment of data engineers, data scientists, physicists, software

engineers, system architects and business leaders to build Big Data platforms and data processing pipelines. You

will develop and implement complex data-driven software solutions and frameworks leveraging cutting-edge

digital frameworks, platforms and tools. In particular, you will be driving the design & specification of Data

Analytics & Machine Learning Pipeline Lifecycle management frameworks to extend our Data Engineering

competence and help define requirements for the ASML Central and Edge Data Analytics Platforms. Being a central

interface of the group that provides business solutions on Predictive Maintenance & Diagnostics, you will be a key

player in further driving our digital transformation. Main tasks:
Translating business needs into platform and pipeline requirements, lead the technical decision making process in

the group and driving standardization of interfaces and deployment strategies
Central liaison for architectural advice, choices and requirements towards stakeholders from Digital Platform, IT,

Competence lead, Predictive Maintenance Architect and System Engineering.
Driving high-level definitions & designs and technical decision making towards Central Data Analytics Platform,

Self-Service Analytics Program, and AnalyticsLab on Edge Platform
Together with manager support Product Owners, Business & Competence Architects and group members to

implement, deploy and sustain data-driven solutions from the group to serve internal and external customers
Confidential
Coach Data Engineers from junior to senior level, support development of Data Engineering training curriculum,

engage in internal and external Data Engineering community
Sparring partner for department management on vision and roadmap for data value generation and digital

transformation
Education and experience
MSc or PhD in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Big Data Engineering, Data Science or related.
Skills
Working at the cutting edge of tech, you’ll always have new challenges and new problems to solve - and working together is the only way to do that. You won’t work in a silo. Instead, you’ll be part of a creative, dynamic work environment where you’ll collaborate with supportive colleagues. There is always space for creative and unique points of view. You’ll have the flexibility and trust to choose how best to tackle tasks and solve problems.
To thrive in this job, you’ll need the following skills:
Hard skills:
Proven track record in solution architecting based on >5 years of hands-on experience in building

complex Big Data platforms and pipelines (ETL, both batch- and stream-data processing)
Solid knowledge of software system design and distributed architectures
Hands-on experience managing and using distributed data management systems and clusters (e.g. HDFS,

Cassandra, Druid, HBase, MongoDB, Parquet, Ceph, ZooKeeper)
Hands-on experience managing and using Big Data processing frameworks (e.g. Spark, Kafka, Hive, Spark,

Drill, Impala, Flume, Storm, Flink, Ray)
Hands-on experience managing and using cloud environments and processing frameworks (e.g.

GCP/VertexAI, Azure/Databricks)
Proven experience with driving data solutions towards effective and secure deployment, incl DataOps and

MLOps and API development
Knowledge of programming paradigms (e.g. declarative, imperative, dataflow, object-oriented, event?driven, functional) and design patterns and best practices
Hands-on experience with Python, Java, SQL programming languages
Experience in setting up both SQL as well as noSQL databases
Deployment and provisioning automation and orchestration tools (e.g. Docker, Kubernetes, Openshift,

CI/CD, Airflow, Argo, Dagster)
Basic knowledge of security, authentication, authorization, encryption (LDAP / Kerberos / PAM)
Affinity with designing and deploying Machine Learning solutions is a plus
Soft skills:
Excellent communicator, who can convince across disciplines, result-driven attitude, technical leadership

and vision
Team player, good social and team leadership skills, pro-active and customer-oriented
Practical approach, being able to work in a high demanding, result driven environment
Thinks creative, out of the box, self-going, fast learner
Senior, independent mindset, can deal with complex and uncertain environments under pressure
Personal authority in the domain is needed with extensive and pioneering experience in data solutions

and data engineering.

Wil jij jouw kennis van bedrijfsprocessen, data en managementinformatie inzetten voor onze opdracht: zorgen dat daders voor de rechter komen en slachtoffers geholpen worden? Dan is de functie van Business Analist bij het OM Midden Nederland iets voor jou!
Wat ga je doen?
Arrondissementsparket Midden-Nederland, ook wel het OM Midden-Nederland genoemd, zorgt voor de opsporing en vervolging van strafbare feiten binnen de provincies Utrecht en Flevoland en de Gooi- en Vechtstreek. Als business analist binnen dit parket ben jij de bedrijfsvoering specialist als het gaat om voorraden van zaken, productie binnen de diverse afdelingen, instroom en doorlooptijden van strafzaken. In deze rol zorg jij er (data)gedreven voor dat er een link ontstaat tussen proces en prestatie. Je werkt nauw samen met de business controller, logistiek procesexperts, kwaliteitsmedewerkers, teamleiders en adviseurs bedrijfsvoering. Met en voor hen ontwikkel jij tools en dashboards zodat het inzichtelijk wordt wat de prestaties zijn, wat bottlenecks zijn of waar procesverbeteringen mogelijk zijn. Je constateert, adviseert en zorgt ervoor dat de door jou verkregen data en/of gemaakte instrumenten bij de juiste personen belandt. Je geeft daarbij gevraagd en ongevraagd advies en inzichten. Daarnaast heb je ook een grote rol in het technisch doorontwikkelen van oplossingen. Jij verzint creatieve constructies om cruciale informatie en verbindingen boven tafel te krijgen. Wanneer er ontwikkelingen of veranderende omstandigheden zijn (bijvoorbeeld wetswijzigingen) ben jij aan zet om een prognose op te maken welke invloed dit heeft op de bedrijfsvoering van het OM. Daarnaast werk je mee aan het optimaliseren van resultaatsturing binnen de teams en geef je de organisatie meer inzicht in factoren zoals personeelstekort die van invloed kunnen zijn op de operatie.
De afwisseling tussen analytisch werk en het opzoeken van de samenwerking werkt voor jou. Jij bent iemand die uitdaging vindt in het uitpluizen van managementinformatie en computerwerk, maar tegelijkertijd ook diverse overleggen en communicatiemomenten opzoekt om de verbinding te maken met je in- en externe collega’s.
In deze functie krijg jij de ruimte om jouw kennis en ervaring in te zetten voor de ontwikkeling van de functie en rol van business analist binnen het parket Tijdens je inwerkperiode wordt je begeleidt en maak je kennis met de organisatie. Daarnaast krijg je diverse opleidingen, cursussen en themadagen aangeboden om je ontwikkeling te stimuleren.
Wie ben je?
Je bent een autonome denker, je durft op te komen voor je eigen ideeën en gaat een zakelijke discussie niet uit de weg. Dat neemt niet weg dat je weet te verbinden en actief de samenwerking met collega’s opzoekt. Je bent analytisch sterk: je weet de juiste informatie te vinden en legt verbanden tussen gegevens en/of vraagstukken. Je hanteert bij je analyse verschillende invalshoeken en bent cijfermatig onderlegd. Je hebt een uitstekende kijk op processen en bent in staat deze te analyseren en weet duidelijke adviezen te geven om deze te verbeteren en te beheersen.
Verder heb je:
Een afgeronde hbo opleiding in big data analytics, informatie en data, bedrijfskundige informatica of business en IT. We staan ook open voor andere studierichtingen zoals Data Science en nodigen je van harte uit te solliciteren als je vanuit een andere invalshoek denkt te kunnen bijdragen in deze functie. De toelichting zien we graag in je brief terug;
Minimaal 2 jaar aantoonbare ervaring met informatieanalyse en businessanalyse;
Ervaring in het werken met BI tools en hebt affiniteit met innovatie en IT; Daarnaast heb je ook uitstekende kennis van office-producten zoals Excel;
Je beheerst de Nederlandse taal voldoende in woord en geschrift.
Kennis van SQL en OBIEE is een pre;
Kennis van het strafrecht en de strafrechtketen is een pre.
Waar kom je te werken?
Het Arrondissementsparket Midden-Nederland is gevestigd in het centrum van Utrecht met uitzicht op de Dom en de prachtige binnenstad, nabij het centraal station. Maar ons parket heeft meer te bieden. Wij leveren een waardevolle bijdrage aan een veiligere samenleving in onze regio. Kom je bij ons parket werken dan zet jij je samen met de ruim 300 medewerkers in voor de strafrechtelijke handhaving van de rechtsorde en lever je een waardevolle bijdrage aan een veiligere samenleving in onze regio. Door oog te hebben voor slachtoffers, snelheid te tonen in afhandeling van zaken en het ontnemen van crimineel vermogen, en te werken aan daadwerkelijke, snelle en volledige executie, juridisch vakmanschap en een efficiënte proceslogistiek wordt dit bereikt.
Overige arbeidsvoorwaarden
Naast het salaris ontvang je een individueel keuzebudget (IKB). Dit bestaat uit geld (16,37% van je bruto jaarsalaris) en tijd. Die tijd zijn bovenwettelijke uren, naar rato omvang dienstverband en leeftijd. Met het IKB maak jij de keuzes die bij jou passen en kun je een deel van je arbeidsvoorwaarden zelf samenstellen. Je kunt er bijvoorbeeld voor kiezen om een deel van het budget te laten uitbetalen wanneer jij dat wenst. Ook kun je dit budget omzetten in extra verlof en andersom, of besteden aan fiscaalvriendelijke doelen. De Rijksoverheid hecht sterk aan persoonlijke groei en loopbaanontwikkeling en biedt daarvoor tal van mogelijkheden. Tot de secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden behoren onder meer verschillende studiefaciliteiten, bedrijfsfitness, volledige vergoeding van je ov-reiskosten woon-werkverkeer en gedeeltelijk betaald ouderschapsverlof.
Werken bij het Openbaar Ministerie
Het Openbaar Ministerie (OM) zorgt voor opsporing en vervolging van strafbare feiten. Bij het OM werken ruim vijfduizend medewerkers met diverse (culturele) achtergronden, opleidingen en kwaliteiten. Het is belangrijk dat alle collega’s zich bij het OM thuis voelen en gerespecteerd en gewaardeerd worden. Ook in talent en groei. Lees hier meer.
Bijzonderheden
Het betreft een functie voor 36 uur.
Een salaris in schaal 11 (dit komt neer op minimaal 3608,64 en maximaal 5503,57). Je wordt ingeschaald op basis van opleiding, kennis en ervaring.
Het kunnen overleggen van een VOG maakt onderdeel uit van de procedure.
Een selecterend ontwikkelassessment maakt deel uit van de procedure.
Twijfel je of je de juiste werkervaring hebt? Neem dan vooral contact met ons op! Samen kunnen we de mogelijkheden bespreken.
Meer informatie
Wil je meer weten over de functie? Neem dan contact op met Ruud Bloembergen, Directeur Bedrijfsvoering via a.r.k.bloembergen@om.nl. Heb je vragen over de sollicitatieprocedure? Dan kun je contact opnemen met Romina Golshahi, Recruiter via r.golshahi@om.nl.
Sollicitatiewijze
Je kan je sollicitatiebrief en cv uploaden tot en met 6-6-2023 o.v.v. vacaturenummer OM-1843 via de knop solliciteer hieronder.

Juist die eigenschappen maken jou tot een hooggewaardeerde Data Scientist voor TVM en voor onze klanten. In jouw functie bij TVM is geen werkdag hetzelfde. Onze interne en externe klanten doen graag een beroep op jouw expertise in het persoonlijk toelichten van insights. Je zult merken dat je snel de steun en toeverlaat wordt van je collega’s en klanten. In je werktijd is er veel ruimte voor vrij onderzoek en creatief ontwikkelen van innovatieve datatoepassingen. De teamleden zijn verdeeld over verschillende werkgroepen in de organisatie en nemen de opdrachten mee terug naar de backlog van het team. Sleutelwoorden zijn 360-graden schadebeeld, rijgedrag data, geografische analyses, statistische analyses, en verrijkingen met externe data.Met jouw kennis en ervaring gaan we graag verder met onze ontdekkingstocht naar veilig transport voor transport en logistieke bedrijven in Europa.Jouw werk bestaat uit opdrachten ophalen van interne klanten, opdracht vertalen naar analyses, middelen verzamelen van de data (interne & externe data) en vervolgens je aannames en uitkomsten rapporteren naar je klanten. We geven je ruimte voor eigen initiatief en het vormgeven van je creativiteit en ondernemerschap. Al ruim 10 jaar is deze partij in omgeving Rotterdam bezig met software voor automatische taxatie van woningen en vastgoed. Daarnaast verwerken ze vastgoed data, waardoor banken, verzekeraars en consumenten efficiënter taxaties kunnen opvragen. Deze gevestigde partij monitort dagelijks ruim 7 miljoen woningen en taxeert er wekelijks zo’n 20.000. Dit doen ze met een kleine, hechte club van 12 man, maar mogen zich de grootste taxateur van Nederland noemen. Naast het sales-team is iedereen binnen deze partij technisch onderlegd en van universitair niveau. De sfeer is heel informeel en iedereen krijgt de kans om mee te denken met de organisatie.
Functie
Zoals hierboven al aangegeven, is het niveau binnen deze organisatie enorm hoog. Samen met het IT-team van 6 man spar je op hoog niveau over de softwareoplossingen op development- en datagebied. Dagelijks werk je aan de webservices, pipelines, databases en webapplicaties, die het automatische woningtaxatiemodel ontsluiten naar de klanten. Denk hierbij aan grote banken, verzekeraars, maar ook consumenten. Deze applicaties moeten onderhouden worden, uitgebreid worden met nieuwe releases en updates en verder aangepast worden op de wensen van de klant.
Om de klanten een nog beter advies te kunnen geven hebben ze besloten om data science technologieën te gaan implementeren. Jouw taken zullen dus ook het maken van machine learning algoritmes en het ontwerpen van voorspellende modellen zijn.

Unique opportunity to join a leading global Private Equity investor
Werkervaring
2 - 5 jaar
Opleidingsniveau
WO
Functieniveau
Medior

Jouw rol
PGGM Private Equity is a leading global private equity investor which invests c. 3bn annually and has c. 20 billion of assets under management. It has a mandate to invest globally in private equity funds, co-investments and secondaries, through which it aims to balance return and risk while also contributing to social and environmental goals. PGGM continues to push the envelope to achieve more ambitious ESG goals, including a Paris Aligned portfolio in 2040.
The Private Equity team consists of 30+ FTEs with backgrounds in private equity, investment banking and consulting. The team is diverse, young, ambitious, international and will continue to grow over the next years. The Private Equity team is based in PGGM’s office in Zeist, The Netherlands. PGGM has an emphasis on responsible investments and impact, transparency, governance and costs.
In this role you will… …collect, gather and aggregate ESG data on macro levels to derive new insights. …contribute to the development of process automation and process design of data-intensive processes for ESG monitoring and reporting. … analyze a broad range of financial and ESG data to detect potential ESG risks and opportunities and to measure the ESG performance of funds, individual assets or on aggregated PE level.
 …conduct own research on a wide range of topics in sustainable investing to further push the envelope in relation to ESG and impact. …support the Head of ESG in setting up new ESG initiatives and pro-actively propose initiatives based on your analyses and research. …develop and maintain relations with ESG data providers and platforms and keep track of the latest developments.
Jouw afdeling binnen PGGM
Private Equity department:
As ESG Data Analyst -Private Equity you will be based in the Private Equity department of PGGM. You will be part of the Portfolio Analysis team. You will support the Private Equity team in all ESG-related initiatives, including ESG monitoring and reporting and data analysis. You will also support the ESG target setting. You will work closely with the Head of ESG and the portfolio analysis team. In this new role you will get the chance to work on different tasks while also being allowed a good degree of autonomy.
Jouw achtergrond
 Bachelor degree in Computer Science, Finance, Economics, Econometrics or a related field. Master degree nice to have but not a must. 3-5 years of work experience.
 Experience with programming in Python, SQL and/or VBA, or similar. Experience with Power BI is a plus. Strong interest in technology and high affinity with IT-related topics.
 Advanced analytical skills, strong problem-solving skills, and the ability to synthesize insights from data.
 Strong interest in climate change and sustainability topics and a basic understanding of sustainable investing. Basic knowledge of financial markets; an interest in private equity is a plus. Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and with people at all levels of the organization including IT departments, portfolio managers, risk managers, etc. The ability to communicate effectively in English, both in writing and verbally, is a must.
Wat wij bieden
PGGM Investments continues to build teams of talented and experienced professionals to act on its vital responsibility to manage the investments on behalf of pension funds and strive to achieve it with excellence, integrity and performance. In your role you ultimately contribute to the pension schemes of 2.9 million Dutch beneficiaries. Senior Machine Learning Engineer - MLOps
As a Senior MLOps Engineer you will be the owner of our development environment, helping our team of NLP engineers train and test our models with popular solutions on the market such as DVC and MLFlow. You will also have control on how our ML product works within our production environments, helping bring better code practices into our deployed solutions.
Together with your colleagues you will form a small, cosy and self-organising team. As a team you are responsible for building the infrastructure, implementing the algorithms and converting them to production ready models. Additionally, you will be part of a larger, cross-functional and dynamic team consisting of developers, designers, medical consultants and data engineers.
Medical data is an interesting problem space, both in complexity and in societal value. The texts are a domain of its own with extremely high information density. It gives a real kick when users let us know they were able to collect data that they were unable to collect without CTcue, such as finding people with a rare disease that might take years otherwise to diagnose or rapidly building quality datasets for COVID research.
Key responsibilities:
Mature and improve our CI/CD tools and components, and maintain CI/CD pipelines across multiple environments
Python code optimization, containerization, deployment, versioning, and monitoring of its quality
Data science models testing, validation and tests automation
Develop and deploy scalable tools and services on our sites to handle machine learning training and inference
Identify and evaluate new technologies to improve performance, maintainability, and reliability of our deployed machine learning systems
Design and implement future cloud solutions, build MLOps on cloud (Azure)
Apply software engineering rigor and best practices to machine learning, including CI/CD, automation, etc.
Your profile
You are a professional who is passionate about improving healthcare and having a real impact. A background in Machine Learning is nice to have, but we will also value DevOps experience and a solid interest in AI. You have an appetite to learn and to develop yourself, an innate curiosity, and you can bring to light clarity around abstract and unclear problems. You feel comfortable working in a self-organising company where there is little hierarchy. You feel at home in maturing our ML ops solution and helping you fellow data scientist create better products.
What we’re looking for:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or Software Engineering
Substantial experience in Python
Ability to understand tools used by data scientist and experience with software development and test automation
Ability to design and implement scalable solutions and ability to build MLOps pipelines on (cloud) solutions
Experience with MLOps Frameworks like Kubeflow, MLFlow, DVC/CML, etc., experience with CUDA, Docker and Kubernetes
Strong software engineering skills (Python), good understanding of Linux, knowledge of Deep Learning frameworks (such as PyTorch, Tensorflow, etc.)
Experience in using MS Azure (preferred) or GCP, AWS services
The team
Today we are used to having most information - anywhere in the world - right at our fingertips. It may therefore surprise you that this is not the case at all for the hospital world. When we (CTcue department) started building the Patient Finder search engine, we thought we could build a simple application that could automatically identify patients for clinical trials. However, in the process of developing this, we have gradually come to see that we are building something much more fundamental.
The problem in hospitals is that the data in the Electronic Health Record (EHR) is not suitable for performing automated analyses. About 70% of the data consists of text (unstructured data), and standard BI tools cannot handle that well. The result is that in practice manual searches are still the default.
We have developed a data platform in which the unstructured data is organized using machine learning / NLP and then stored together with the structured data from the EHR. The platform contains two innovative applications with which the EHR data can be searched and collected.
Our aim has always been to support doctors in their work using data technology and it is with this in mind that we continue to develop and expand our platform. It goes without saying that privacy legislation forms a guideline in this. Our search engine is currently used daily in more than 40 hospitals in the Netherlands and Belgium. Our ambition is to expand the footprint of our platform to other key care and research hospitals across EMEA over the next few years.
Those who join us become part of a recognized global leader still willing to challenge the status quo to improve patient care. In this business unit, you will have access to the most cutting-edge technology, the largest data sets, the best analytics tools and, in our opinion, some of the finest minds in the Healthcare industry.
We thank all applicants for their interest; however only those selected for interview will be contacted.

Als Data Scientist ben jij de sleutel tot het ontsluiten van waardevolle inzichten en het nemen van data-gedreven beslissingen. Met jouw vaardigheden in Predictive Analytics en Machine Learning kun je niet alleen trends voorspellen, maar ook inzichten ontdekken die kunnen leiden tot baanbrekende innovaties. Jouw werk als Data Scientist gaat verder dan het verzamelen en analyseren van gegevens; het gaat om het creëren van impact en het veranderen van de wereld om ons heen.
In deze uitdagende functie werk je samen met andere getalenteerde professionals en krijg je de kans om je vaardigheden en kennis voortdurend te verbeteren door middel van training en ontwikkelingsmogelijkheden. Je werkt met de nieuwste technologieën en krijgt de vrijheid om jouw creativiteit en innovatieve ideeën in te zetten bij het vinden van oplossingen voor complexe problemen. Lees meer…
Lees meer.....
JIJ BENT het belangrijkste in ons bedrijf en daarom draait alles om jou. Bij ons staan de 5 V’s van Victory centraal: vurigheid, vrijheid, vertrouwen, verantwoordelijkheid en verbinding. Deze kernwaarden vormen de basis van alles wat we doen en we willen dat jij daar ook van profiteert.

Wat je doet
(n)iets voor jou?
 Wij creëren een omgeving waarin we de kracht van diversiteit benutten.
De grootste uitdaging
Bij bol.com is het altijd druk. In piekperiodes worden er tot wel 500.000 bestellingen per dag geplaatst. Om die goed en snel te verwerken, moeten we de capaciteit van ons logistieke netwerk slim benutten. Bijvoorbeeld door bestellingen door het ene of juist het andere warehouse uit te laten leveren, zodat we meer of minder mensen hoeven in te zetten. Om deze sturing te verbeteren en optimaal te faciliteren, werken we aan een state-of-the-art logistiek data fundament. Onze logistieke netwerken worden steeds complexer. Hoe completer en accurater onze master data is, hoe beter onze modellen kunnen voorspellen en adviseren. Voorbeelden van logistieke master data zijn de verpakkingsdimensies, de kwetsbaarheid of de verschillende paden die een product kan afleggen door ons logistieke netwerk. Sinds vorig jaar bouwen we met een team aan het opzetten van een centraal master data fundament waar ons hele logistieke netwerk gebruik van kan maken.

Wat je doet als Proces Engineer Logistiek Data Fundament
Als proces engineer ben je verantwoordelijk voor het runnen van het innovatieproject van begin tot eind: vanaf het eerste idee tot de go-live! Daarin heb je een leidende rol om bij de logistieke operatie de gebruikersbehoefte op te halen, oplossingsrichtingen uit te denken en deze in iteraties te realiseren. Uiteraard samen met de software engineers en data-analist in het team. Ook denk je mee over de lange termijn. Waar willen we over een jaar staan met de logistieke menukaart en wat vraagt dat vandaag van ons?


In het kort
Je initieert en leidt bol.com brede innovatie projecten welke een grote bijdrage leveren aan de optimalisatie van het bol.com fulfilment netwerk
Je houdt van een inhoudelijke uitdaging en bent ook goed in de zachte kant; het meenemen van stakeholders en aandacht voor implementatie
Je hebt technische affiniteit en deinst niet terug van een groot landschap met veel applicaties
Je bent kritisch op de waarde van alles wat we doen en breekt grote innovatie strategieën op in kleine stappen op basis van waarde (we kunnen niet alles in één keer doen…)
Je hebt een innovatieve mindset en durft vanuit een eerste MVP verder te itereren zonder alles al uitgedacht te hebben

Wat je nog meer krijgt
Jouw pensioen
Je pensioen wordt volledig geregeld door bol.com.
Flexibele werkcultuur
We voegen het beste van twee werelden samen, zodat de balans tussen organisatie- en individuele behoeften goed blijft. Dit betekent 50% werken op kantoor en 50% vanuit huis.
In de bonus
Aan het eind van het jaar krijg je een bonus.
Sollicitatieproces
Alles dat je moet weten over je sollicitatieproces bij bol.com
Je solliciteert
Wij bekijken je sollicitatie zorgvuldig en binnen twee weken weet je of we je uitnodigen voor een gesprek.
Het eerste contact
Wij nemen telefonisch contact met je op om het eerste gesprek in te plannen. En als we elkaar toch al spreken, pak vooral de kans om alvast prangende vragen te stellen.
Elkaar in het echt (digitaal) ontmoeten
Tijdens het eerste gesprek maken we kennis met elkaar. We zullen ingaan op jouw competenties en je eerdere werkervaring. En natuurlijk ook de inhoud van de functie.
Het tweede gesprek
Voor het tweede gesprek vragen we je om van te voren een online assessment te maken. Bij sommige functies kunnen we je vragen om iets extra's, zoals een business case.
Wederzijdse liefde
Is er een wederzijdse match? Dan doen wij je graag een aanbod bestaande uit een passend salaris en onze arbeidsvoorwaarden. We doen nog een laatste dubbelcheck op het papierwerk in de vorm van een screening. Daarna start jouw avontuur bij bol.com!

NLP Data Science: Innovate, Protect, and Secure with Corsearch!
Are you a passionate data scientist with a keen interest in NLP? Are you looking for a challenging and rewarding role where you can apply your skills to make the world a safer place?
Corsearch, a mission-led company focused on online brand protection and trademark business lines, is seeking an experienced NLP Data Scientist to join our AI team.
We are driven by a passion for making the world better and safer for our brand customers and their consumers. It’s what we do. And people come to Corsearch to be challenged, developed, supported, and valued
The Role & Team
AI team is responsible for researching, designing, implementing and optimizing cutting edge data science solutions in fields like image tech, NLP or fraud.
We’re looking at different methodologies/models and validate them to find the most promising solution to our actual problems.
As a senior data scientist - working in the AI team - you will be involved in projects of different products lines/business area. As NLP data scientist you’ll be responsible to apply SOTA (state of the art) NLP models to our problems including, but not limited to title/snippet/text similarity.
Additionally, you’ll be researching / applying computer linguistic based search/retrieval algorithms as well.
Your work will have a direct impact on our clients' ability to protect their innovations, secure brand value, and thrive commercially.
As part of our AI team, you will have the opportunity to collaborate with other Data Scientists to share knowledge and continuously improve NLP solutions, as well as take part in other machine learning projects utilizing your experiments and general understanding of deep learning principles.
Responsibilities and Duties
Research and implement NLP based solutions in online brand protection and trademark business line
Try different SOTA models for topics like text similarity / search
Work closely with subject matter experts to validate results and share knowledge about the used methodology
Take care of the continuously increasing training/test datasets, verify consistency, offer solution for revisiting labeling issues
Implement the solution based on continuous training principle as user feedbacks and expert reports are available
Think creatively about the implemented solutions, advise new features or tools, innovate
Collaborate with other Data Scientists to share knowledge and continuously improve NLP solutions
Take part in other machine learning projects utilizing your experiments and general understanding of deep learning principles


Essential
MSc or Bachelor degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Artificial Intelligence or related field
Minimum 5 years relevant industry experience in researching/building data science applications
Minimum 3 years relevant industry experience in NLP
Hands-on experiment with Transformer based models, like fine-tuning, transfer learning
Knowledge of search/retrieval algorithms (TF-IDF, n-gram, Aho-Corasick, Suffix trees, etc)
Proficient programming skills in a high-level DS languages (python, R), R shiny experience for prototyping is a plus
Experience with working in cloud (AWS, GCP, Kaggle, etc. )
Broader knowledge of large dataset processing pipelines and distributed computing architectures (Apache Beam/Airflow, Spark/Hadoop architectures)
Knowledge of relational databases, noSQL, memory database technologies, graph processing (Elastic Search, MongoDB, Redis)
Experience with GPU backed modeling/inference
For You
At Corsearch, we value our employees and strive to provide them with the support and benefits they need to succeed. In addition to our highly competitive compensation, we offer a range of fantastic benefits, including:
 Flexible Remote - Remote job from our Amsterdam office, allowing you to work from home or the office as per your preference. You'll travel to our office when needed.
Pension from 1st day - collective pension insurance, providing you with a retirement savings plan to help secure your financial future.

High-end IT equipment - we provide the best tools to help you perform at your best.
NS Business Card - we reimburse your commuting expenses to make your journey to work more comfortable and affordable.
25 days of annual leave + bank holidays - we value work-life balance and provide generous time off to recharge.
Birthday leave - enjoy an additional day off each year to celebrate your special day!
Free office snacks, fruits, drinks, and coffee - stay fueled and refreshed throughout the day.
Friday after-work beer - unwind and socialize with your colleagues over a cold beer on us!
️ Office lunch subscription and more - take advantage of our office lunch subscription service, along with many other perks and benefits that come with working with us
 Why Corsearch?
Corsearch is a leading technology company that specializes in intellectual property solutions. We are constantly at the forefront of web technologies, playing cat and mouse games with pirates who infringe on intellectual property rights. Our cross-functional team runs a distributed application architecture with autonomous and user-driven applications alike dealing with various content types.
Our solutions enable businesses to protect their innovations, secure brand value, and thrive commercially. We are a global company with over 1600 team members serving over 5,000 clients on five continents.

If you are a data scientist with a passion for NLP and a desire to make a difference in the world, then we want to hear from you! At Corsearch, you will have the opportunity to work with cutting-edge technology and collaborate with subject matter experts to develop solutions that protect and strengthen our customers' brands. Plus, you'll enjoy a comprehensive benefits package and a supportive, mission-driven company culture.
So don't wait any longer - apply today to join our AI team and start making a meaningful impact!

Help dataproducten en -analyses te ontwikkelen, en rechters en andere Rechtspraak-medewerkers datagedreven te werken. Draag zo bij aan een digitaal toegankelijke rechtspraak in ons land!

Dat heb je ook zelf in de hand! Want als Data Engineer bij IVO Rechtspraak werk je vanuit een datalab in oprichting. Jij helpt dataproducten en -analyses te ontwikkelen en rechters en andere Rechtspraak-medewerkers datagedreven te werken. Je werkt op het snijvlak van data engineering, ML engineering en cloud engineering. Heel belangrijk dus! En dat is nog niet alles.

Hoe je werk eruitziet

De Rechtspraak wil flinke stappen zetten in datagedreven werken. Daar draag jij op allerlei manieren aan bij vanuit het IVO Datalab. Je kunt je creativiteit helemaal kwijt! Zo ontwikkel je pipelines (Infrastructure as Code) en koppelvlakken voor data ingestion en ben je betrokken bij de deployment van diverse dataproducten. Ook ben je bezig met cloud engineering. Samen met de Cloud Engineers van het lab doe je aan resource deployment en richt je de netwerkinfrastructuur vanaf scratch in. De eerste verkenningen zijn op een on-premise cloud, met later een transitie naar een private cloud. Een mooie gelegenheid om OpenShift en Azure Cloud beter te leren kennen.

Daarnaast ontwikkel je diverse analyseproducten met data scientists, BI-specialisten, juridisch medewerkers en rechters. Dat gaat van een analyse op de datakwaliteit tot het inzetten van de nieuwste technieken voor natural language processing om relevante tekst uit een uitspraak te halen. En hoe geweldig is het om mee te werken aan een model dat alle uitspraken anonimiseert? Daarmee kunnen we ze online openbaar maken voor het publiek of wetenschappelijk onderzoek. Last but not least, bouw je als lid van een scrumteam mee aan een geavanceerde data science-omgeving.

Je eigen Datalab-team is jong en klein, maar je werkt nauw samen met Data Scientists, Data Engineers en Cloud Engineers van onder meer het datalab van het ministerie van Justitie en Veiligheid en het Nederlands Forensisch Instituut. Genoeg sparringpartners en collega’s dus om nieuwe casussen en data-analyses op te pakken! Vind je persoonlijke ontwikkeling en kennisdeling belangrijk? Ook dat komt helemaal goed, want jouw team wil bijblijven met de meest recente industry best practices!

Hou je niet van een gespreid bedje, maar wel van uitdagingen, kansen en de ruimte om je ideeën in de praktijk te brengen? Dan is dit dé baan voor jou!

Functie-eisen

Wat je nog niet weet, leren we je. En wat je nog niet bent, kun je bij ons worden. Maar dit zijn de dingen waar je volgens het ideaalplaatje aan voldoet:

Je hebt minimaal 4 jaar relevante werkervaring als Data Engineer
Je bent sterk in probleemanalyse en het analyseren van requirements
Je bent proactief en herkent en creëert op basis van je eigen kennis en ervaring initiatieven voor de ontwikkeling van diverse dataproducten
Je staat bekend als creatief en klantgericht
Je hebt ervaring met OpenShift, Azure DevOps, Data Factory, Private Endpoints en Azure Resource Management

Kom je bij ons werken, dan vragen we ook altijd een Verklaring Omtrent Gedrag.

Overige arbeidsvoorwaarden

Om te beginnen een leuke, informele werksfeer. We houden de lijnen graag kort! En je arbeidsvoorwaarden zijn prima geregeld volgens de CAO Rijk. Wat belangrijke punten op een rij:

Je salaris is maximaal  5.503 op basis van 36-urige werkweek. Je zit in schaal 11.
Je krijgt een Individueel Keuze Budget (IKB) van maximaal  900 bruto per maand (16,37%). Dit is inclusief je vakantiegeld en eindejaarsuitkering. Je kunt dit budget bijvoorbeeld laten uitkeren of in vrije dagen omzetten.
Je houdt werk en privé prima in balans, bijvoorbeeld door hybride te werken
(minimaal 2 dagen op locatie), de mogelijkheid van 4×9 uur of ouderschapsverlof. Er zijn talloze vergoedingen voor het inrichten van je thuiswerkplek.
Je krijgt 26 vakantiedagen op basis van een 36-urige werkweek.
Binnen de IVO Academy krijg je alle ruimte en is er volop aandacht voor jouw persoonlijke én vaktechnische ontwikkeling.
Bij IVO Rechtspraak stimuleren we reizen met het OV! Je krijgt een OV-chipkaart waarmee je gratis voor je werk reist.
